requirement: The specified airspeed in the flight control law during autonomous control is a value stored in the flight control computer, calculated based on flight performance.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the safety of the process for calculating and storing the given airspeed during autonomous control, preventing unauthorized access and tampering.

The system should periodically verify the stored reference airspeed values in the flight control computer to ensure their accuracy and consistency, and trigger a warning mechanism when anomalies are detected.

The system should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that in the event of a failure in the primary flight control computer, the backup flight control computer can seamlessly take over and continue providing accurate commanded airspeed values.
The system should record each calculation and storage operation of the assigned airspeed for audit and traceability when required.

requirement: The in-band loop remote control converts the remote control input into the corresponding target attitude angle, and calculates the corresponding rudder deflection control commands to manipulate the control surfaces through autonomous control laws (Equations (2-1), (2-2), and (2-3)).
safety_requirements: In the in-band loop remote control mode, the system should ensure accurate and error-free conversion of remote control inputs to prevent erroneous control commands to the control surfaces due to data conversion errors.

The system should monitor in real-time the consistency between remote control inputs and the specified attitude angles, ensure the conversion relationship between the two meets expectations, and trigger an alarm mechanism when anomalies are detected.

The system should ensure the safety and reliability of the computational process for autonomous control laws (Equations (2-1), (2-2), and (2-3)), preventing abnormal control surface commands due to computational errors.

The system should be equipped with fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure timely recovery in case of faults during the computation process, preventing interruptions or erroneous execution of control surface commands.

requirement: Different wc values are selected for different sensor data, and the corresponding a0 and a1 also vary; see Table 3-21 for specific parameters.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when different sensor data is selected, the corresponding wc, a0, and a1 parameters in Table 3-21 are correctly read and applied to guarantee the accuracy of calculation results.

The system should have a parameter validation mechanism to ensure that when selecting different sensor data, the wc, a0, and a1 parameters used comply with the specifications in Table 3-21, preventing calculation errors caused by parameter mistakes.
The system should record detailed logs of each parameter selection and application for traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: The flaps can be extended or retracted according to the needs of different flight phases or remote control requirements. The flap has three deflection positions: 0°, 15°, and 40°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and reliability of flap positions when extending or retracting the flaps, preventing misoperation or position anomalies.
The system should monitor the current flap angle position in real time and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies (such as position deviation exceeding the allowable range).
The system should support the function of remotely controlling the flap position and ensure the integrity and non-repudiation of the remote control commands.
The system should perform multiple verifications when automatically adjusting the flap position during different flight phases to ensure the correctness and safety of the adjustment commands.
The system shall record each change in flap position and provide traceable logs for subsequent analysis and auditing.

requirement: After the aircraft enters the glide path in autonomous or manual correction mode, if it switches to remote control, and then switches back to autonomous control mode when the flight altitude is above the decision height (40m), the aircraft will automatically perform a go-around using a soft transition method from remote control to autonomous control.
safety_requirements: When the system is in remote control mode, if the flight altitude is above the decision height (40m) and it switches back to autonomous control mode, the automatic go-around procedure shall be triggered immediately, ensuring a smooth transition of the flight status during the go-around process.

The system should perform a soft transition when switching from remote control to autonomous mode, ensuring a smooth handover of flight control and avoiding sudden changes in control deflection angles that could lead to flight instability.

When the system switches from remote control to autonomous mode, it should monitor flight altitude and flight status in real time to ensure that the mode switch can only occur above the decision altitude; otherwise, the safety protection mechanism should be triggered.

When the system switches from remote control to autonomous mode, it should record flight parameters before and after the switch, including altitude, speed, attitude, etc., for subsequent analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: During the flare segment, when the flight altitude is below 1.5m, transition to the roll correction segment, and no softening is applied to each channel.
safety_requirements: The system should immediately transition to the roll correction phase when the flight altitude is below 1.5m, ensuring no softening in all channels to guarantee flight safety.
The system should monitor flight altitude in real time to ensure accurate activation of the roll correction phase when the altitude is below 1.5m, and record the switching time and status.
During the system's transition in the roll-to-level phase, control commands for each channel should not be softened to maintain flight stability and safety.

requirement: hg is the given height, taken from the target waypoint height.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the reliability of the data source for the target waypoint altitude hg and prevent unauthorized modifications or tampering.
The system shall perform data integrity and validity checks when reading the target waypoint altitude hg to ensure it is within a reasonable range.
The system should monitor changes in the target waypoint altitude hg in real time, ensure its alignment with the current flight status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Calculate Md3(k) = Kxz * Dz(k)
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accurate values of Kxz and Dz(k) when calculating Md3(k) = Kxz * Dz(k), to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by data errors.

The system should perform real-time verification of the calculated Md3(k) to ensure it conforms to the expected physical characteristics and logical relationships, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the values of Kxz and Dz(k) for each calculation, as well as the calculated result Md3(k), to facilitate subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: Calculate Md4(k) = Md2(k) + Md3(k) + Kxzd * Dz(k)
safety_requirements: When the system calculates Md4(k), it should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the input data Md2(k), Md3(k), Kxzd, and Dz(k) to prevent data tampering or loss.
The system should perform real-time verification of the calculated result Md4(k), ensuring it conforms to the expected mathematical relationship, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record key data and operation logs during the computation process for traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: Calculate Md3(k) = Kyz * Δy(k) + Md2(k) + Kyzd * wy(k)
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the accurate input parameters Kyz, Δy(k), Md2(k), Kyzd, and wy(k) when calculating Md3(k), to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by input errors.
The system should perform real-time verification of the calculated result Md3(k), ensuring it remains within a reasonable range, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting abnormal values.
The system should record the input parameters and results of each calculation to enable traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: In the longitudinal control during the flare phase, calculate h& as the vertical velocity from the radio altimeter after compensation with inertial navigation vertical acceleration.
safety_requirements: In the longitudinal control of the system during the flare phase, the correctness and stability of the inertial navigation vertical acceleration compensation algorithm should be ensured to guarantee the accuracy of the calculated rate of climb/descent h& from the radio altimeter.

The system should monitor in real time the vertical acceleration compensated radio altimeter climb/descent rate h& of the inertial navigation, and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies, to ensure flight safety.
The system should record key parameters and calculation results during the inertial navigation vertical acceleration compensation process for post-analysis tracing and verification.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to achieve control over the drone's flight attitude and trajectory.
safety_requirements: The flight control and management software shall ensure that, under any circumstances, the generation and execution of UAV flight attitude and trajectory control commands comply with predefined safety specifications and standards.

The flight control and management software shall monitor the drone's flight status in real time, ensure its operation within safe limits, and immediately take corrective actions upon detecting anomalies.

The flight control and management software should be designed with redundancy to ensure that in the event of a failure in the primary control system, the backup system can seamlessly take over and guarantee the safe flight of the UAV.
The flight control and management software should record all control commands and flight status data for post-event analysis and traceability in case of anomalies.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to support flight performance management functions.
safety_requirements: The flight control and management software shall ensure the integrity and accuracy of all input data when performing flight performance management functions, preventing data tampering or loss.
The flight control and management software shall monitor flight performance parameters in real time to ensure they remain within safe limits and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The flight control and management software should have authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized users can access and modify flight performance management functions.
The flight control and management software should record all operation logs related to flight performance management for audit and fault analysis.

requirement: Flight Phase Determination Functional Requirement: Automatically determine the current flight phase based on the aircraft's position information and motion parameter information.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of position information and motion parameter data, prevent data tampering or loss, and ensure correct determination of the flight phase.
The system should monitor changes in position information and motion parameter information in real time to ensure timely detection and triggering of the warning mechanism when data anomalies occur.
The system should have a redundant mechanism to ensure accurate determination of the current flight phase in case of a single-point failure.
The system shall record the entire process of determining the flight phase, including input data and calculation results, for post-event auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: Flight Phase Determination Functional Requirements: Divide the entire flight process into 14 phases, each with specific control strategies.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure seamless transitions between control strategies during each flight phase to prevent abnormal flight conditions caused by switching control strategies.

The system should monitor the switching status of flight phases in real time, ensure the correct execution of control strategies at each phase, and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies.
The system should record the switching time of each flight phase and the execution status of control strategies for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: Ground waiting phase: The aircraft is in a shutdown state before takeoff and after complete landing.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that during the ground waiting phase, the aircraft's parking status information is accurately and reliably transmitted to all relevant systems and operators.
The system should monitor the aircraft's shutdown status during the ground waiting phase to ensure that all safety-related systems and equipment are in normal operating condition.
The system should prevent unauthorized personnel from operating the aircraft during the ground waiting phase to ensure the aircraft's safety.
The system should record all operations and status changes during the ground waiting phase for auditing and traceability when required.

requirement: Takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll phase): Control the aircraft's lateral deviation and yaw angle relative to the runway centerline through differential braking on left and right sides as well as rudder deflection; control the aircraft's longitudinal motion according to a given pitch angle.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of differential braking and rudder deflection in real-time during the takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll phase) to ensure their proper operation, thereby controlling the aircraft's lateral deviation from the runway centerline and yaw angle.

The system shall ensure the integrity and accuracy of data used to control the aircraft's lateral deviation from the runway centerline and yaw angle via differential braking and rudder deflection during the takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll segment).

During the ground takeoff phase (takeoff roll phase), the system should monitor the aircraft's longitudinal pitch angle in real time to ensure it is controlled according to the specified value and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system shall ensure the safety and reliability of all control command transmissions and executions during the takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll phase), preventing unauthorized interference or tampering.

requirement: Takeoff climb segment: From the point where altitude and airspeed reach certain values to the safety altitude, primarily controlling the aircraft to climb at a specific pitch angle.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor altitude and airspeed in real time during the takeoff departure phase, ensuring they reach the preset values before automatically activating the pitch angle control function.
The system should ensure that the output commands of the pitch angle control function are accurate during the takeoff departure phase to maintain stable climb of the aircraft.

The system should have the capability to detect and handle abnormal situations during the takeoff phase, such as promptly triggering a warning mechanism and implementing safety measures when altitude or airspeed does not reach the preset value.
The system shall record all critical parameters and operation logs during the takeoff and landing phases for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: Climb Segment 1: From the safety altitude (80m) to the phase where flaps are retracted. The main task is to control the aircraft to continue climbing, transitioning longitudinal control to airspeed control, and retracting landing gear and flaps in sequence.
safety_requirements: During the system's first climb phase, it should monitor the aircraft's altitude and airspeed in real time to ensure they remain within safe limits, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

During the system's climb phase 1, it should ensure that the landing gear and flaps are retracted according to the predetermined sequence and timing, to prevent safety issues caused by incorrect operation sequence or delays.

During the system's climb phase 1, the status of the landing gear and flaps shall be monitored in real time to ensure proper retraction, and immediate safety measures shall be taken upon detecting any anomalies.
During the system's climb phase 1, it should ensure smooth transition of longitudinal control to prevent flight instability or loss of control caused by control switching.

requirement: Climb Segment 2: From flap retraction until reaching the required cruising altitude, or climbing from one altitude to a higher altitude, controlling the aircraft's longitudinal movement according to the specified airspeed and laterally to follow the pre-programmed route.
safety_requirements: During the second climb phase, the system should monitor the flap status in real time to ensure that the flaps are fully retracted before continuing the climb operation.
During the second climb phase of the system, the aircraft's altitude should be monitored in real time to ensure that the climb stops upon reaching the required cruising altitude or target altitude.
During the second climb phase of the system, longitudinal control should be performed according to the given airspeed to ensure that the airspeed remains within the safe range.
During the system's climb phase 2, lateral control should be conducted according to the pre-bound route to ensure the aircraft follows the predetermined flight path.

During the second climb phase of the system, it should detect in real time the consistency between flight status and control commands, ensuring that an alarm mechanism is triggered and corresponding safety measures are taken in case of anomalies.

requirement: Altitude Hold Phase: Longitudinal control of the aircraft's altitude and airspeed, lateral control of the offset distance to enable the aircraft to fly at the required altitude and airspeed.
safety_requirements: During the altitude-holding phase, the system should monitor the aircraft's altitude and airspeed in real time to ensure they meet the predetermined values, and trigger a warning mechanism if deviations occur.

The system should ensure the accuracy of lateral offset control during the altitude hold phase to prevent the aircraft from deviating from the predetermined flight path, and promptly adjust or trigger a warning upon detecting anomalies.

The system should have fault detection and isolation capabilities during the altitude hold phase to ensure timely switching to a backup system or implementation of safety measures when sensor or control system failures occur.
The system should record all critical parameters and operation logs during the altitude-holding phase for post-analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: During descent below 5000 meters, the throttle limit is not less than 6%, and the change range is [-6.5%, 10%].
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the throttle limit in real time when descending below 5,000 meters to ensure it is not less than 6%, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
When the system descends below 5,000 meters, it should ensure that the throttle change remains within the range of [-6.5%, 10%], and trigger a warning mechanism when exceeding this range.
The system should record the throttle limit and variation during descent below 5000 meters to ensure data integrity and traceability.

requirement: When the aircraft passes through an altitude of 5000 meters, linearly reduce the throttle trim adjustment to zero at a rate of 5% per second.
safety_requirements: The system shall, in real time, monitor the accuracy of altitude data when the aircraft crosses an altitude of 5000 meters, ensuring that the throttle fine-tuning amount linearly decreases to zero at a rate of 5% per second.

The system should have a highly redundant data detection mechanism to ensure that in the event of a primary altitude sensor failure, it can switch to a backup sensor and continue performing the linear reduction of throttle fine-tuning to zero.
The system should perform real-time monitoring and recording during the process of linearly reducing the throttle fine-tuning amount to zero, ensuring continuity and traceability of the operation.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that can promptly trigger warnings and take corresponding safety measures when anomalies occur in the altitude data or throttle trim adjustments.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to support mission equipment management functionality.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that access to the task device management function is restricted to authorized users only, preventing unauthorized access and operations.
The system should record logs of all task device management operations, including operation time, user, and content, for audit and traceability.
The system should provide real-time monitoring of the task equipment status to ensure timely alarms and appropriate actions in case of abnormalities.
The system should ensure the data integrity of the task device management function, preventing data from being tampered with or corrupted during transmission and storage.
The system should support fault detection and recovery mechanisms for mission equipment, ensuring that the equipment can automatically recover or switch to a safe state in case of failure.

requirement: The longitudinal control for the glide path is the same as the altitude hold on the final approach; refer to Volume 6, Glide Path Handling section for specified altitudes.
safety_requirements: When the system performs longitudinal control during the glide slope segment 1, it should ensure the given altitude refers to the glide path processing section in Part 6, and perform real-time verification when altitude data changes, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
The system should have a highly redundant data verification mechanism to ensure timely detection and appropriate response in case of abnormal altitude data, preventing loss of flight status control.

The system should monitor in real time the execution status of longitudinal control during the first glide segment, ensure its consistency with the control logic for maintaining a constant altitude on the final approach, and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting any deviation.

requirement: The lateral control during the glide phase 1 is the same as during the climb phase 2.
safety_requirements: When the system performs lateral control during descent phase 1, it shall ensure that its logic and parameters are exactly the same as those during climb phase 2 to guarantee consistency and reliability of control.

The system should monitor the control parameters of the glide slope segment 1 and the climb segment 2 in real time to ensure there are no abnormal changes during the transition, and immediately trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.

requirement: The glide 1 section flap airspeed closed-loop control formula is δp = Kp (vg - vk), with δp clamped between [12.5%, 100%]. The reference airspeed is the glide speed specified in the appendix.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the accuracy of Kp, vg, and vk values when calculating δp, and the result of δp shall be within the range of [12.5%, 100%].
The system should monitor the calculated results of δp in real time to ensure they remain within the amplitude limit range and trigger a warning mechanism when exceeding the range.
The system should periodically verify the accuracy of the given airspeed to ensure it matches the descent speed specified in the appendix.
The system should have fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure that it can promptly return to a safe state in case of anomalies during the calculation of δp.

requirement: The longitudinal control of glide segment 2 is the same as that of glide segment 1.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the longitudinal control logic and parameters during the execution of Glide Slope Segment 2 are completely consistent with those of Glide Slope Segment 1 to guarantee consistency and stability of the flight status.

The system should monitor the control parameters of both the glide slope segment 2 and segment 1 in real time to ensure no abnormal changes occur during the switching process, and trigger an early warning mechanism when anomalies are detected.

safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the input parameters Δy and wy are within the amplitude limit range [- XfFxd, XfFxd] when calculating the heading control formula yg, to prevent the calculation result from exceeding the safety range.

The system should monitor the calculation results of the heading control formula yg in real time to ensure they remain within the amplitude limit range, and trigger a warning mechanism when exceeding this range.

The system should regularly verify the values of the heading control formula parameters Kyz, KyzI, Kys, and Kyzd to ensure their accuracy and consistency, preventing control failure caused by parameter errors.

requirement: The glide 2 segment throttle airspeed closed-loop control is the same as that of glide 1 segment.
safety_requirements: When the system switches to the airspeed closed-loop control of the second glide segment throttle, it should ensure that the control logic is exactly the same as that of the first glide segment, to avoid control errors caused by logic differences.

The system should monitor in real-time the performance parameters of the glide slope segment two throttle airspeed closed-loop control to ensure they are consistent with expectations, and immediately trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.

The system should have fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure that during the glide slope 2-segment throttle airspeed closed-loop control process, any faults can be promptly identified and addressed to guarantee flight safety.

requirement: The discretization formula is Md2(k) = KxzI * Md1(k), with Md2(k) clamped between [- XfGama / 0.6, + XfGama].
safety_requirements: When the system calculates Md2(k), it should ensure that the values of KxzI and Md1(k) are within the valid range, preventing calculation errors caused by abnormal input data.

The system should perform a magnitude check on the calculation result of Md2(k) to ensure its value is within the range [- XfGama / 0.6, + XfGama]. If the value exceeds this range, an exception handling mechanism should be triggered.
The system should monitor the calculation process of Md2(k) in real time to ensure it stays within the clamping range, and promptly record and trigger an alarm upon detecting any anomalies.

requirement: The Md5(k) is subjected to amplitude limiting within the range [-XfGama, XfGama].
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the amplitude limiting result of Md5(k) in real time to ensure that it remains within the range [-XfGama, XfGama].
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that immediately triggers an alarm and records the anomaly event when the value of Md5(k) exceeds the limit range.
The system should ensure the correctness and stability of the algorithm for amplitude limiting processing, preventing safety issues caused by algorithm errors.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to support the flight phase determination function.
safety_requirements: The flight control and management software shall ensure the integrity and accuracy of input data when determining the flight phase, to prevent incorrect determination of the flight phase due to data errors.

The flight control and management software should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure that the determined flight phase is consistent with the actual flight status, and promptly trigger the warning mechanism when anomalies are detected.
The flight control and management software shall record critical operations and status information when determining the flight phase, to facilitate post-event auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: Calculate yg(k) = -Md5(k)
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the integrity and validity of input data when calculating yg(k) = -Md5(k), to prevent errors in calculation results caused by data corruption or tampering.
The system should perform real-time validation of the computed results yg(k), ensure they conform to the expected computational logic, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Calculate Md2(k) = KyzI * Md1(k)
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the input data for KyzI and Md1(k) when calculating Md2(k) = KyzI * Md1(k), to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by data errors.
The system should monitor the calculation results of Md2(k) in real time to ensure they are within a reasonable range and trigger an early warning mechanism when abnormal values are detected.
The system should record the input and output data for each calculation to enable traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: The Md2(k) is subjected to amplitude limiting within the range of [-XfFxd, XfFxd].
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the amplitude limiting process of Md2(k) in real time to ensure its value always remains within the range [-XfFxd, XfFxd].
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that immediately triggers an alarm and takes appropriate safety measures when Md2(k) exceeds the amplitude limit.
The system should record each event where Md2(k) exceeds the amplitude limit range for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: Limit the value of Md3(k) within the range [-XfFxd, XfFxd]
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the amplitude limiting process of Md3(k) in real time, ensuring its value remains within the range [-XfFxd, XfFxd]. If the value exceeds this range, the exception handling mechanism should be triggered.
The system should record detailed information for each amplitude limiting process, including the values before and after limiting, processing time, etc., for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

The system should have a redundant mechanism for amplitude limiting processing to ensure that when the primary processing module fails, the backup module can take over and continue performing the amplitude limiting processing.

requirement: Calculate yg(k) = -Md3(k)
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the accuracy and integrity of the input data Md3(k) when calculating yg(k) = -Md3(k), to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by data errors.
The system should perform real-time validation on the calculated results yg(k) to ensure they meet expected physical and logical constraints, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: In the longitudinal control of the flare segment, calculate vyg as the given vertical speed, vyg = vyt + (h - ht)(vyf - vyt)
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the input values of vyt, h, ht, and vyf are valid and within a reasonable range when calculating vyg, to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by input errors.

The system should monitor the calculation results of vyg in real time to ensure that their relationship with the current flight altitude h and target altitude ht complies with expectations, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should have redundant computing capabilities to ensure that when the primary computing module fails, the backup module can promptly take over and continue calculating vyg, thereby ensuring flight safety.

requirement: In the longitudinal control during the flare phase, calculate vygSemi as the automatic correction value for the given pitch rate
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of the input vertical speed data when calculating vygSemi, to prevent abnormal calculation results caused by data errors.
The system should monitor the calculation results of vygSemi in real time to ensure they remain within reasonable ranges and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies.

The system should have redundant computing capabilities to ensure that when the primary computing module fails, the backup module can promptly take over the computing tasks, guaranteeing the continuity and reliability of longitudinal control during the flare segment.

requirement: In the longitudinal control of the flare segment, duy is calculated as the given pitch acceleration.
safety_requirements: In the longitudinal control of the system during the flare phase, the calculated value of the elevator acceleration duy should be ensured to remain within the safe range, preventing it from exceeding the structural and performance limitations of the aircraft.

The system should monitor the calculated vertical acceleration (duy) in real time to ensure its consistency with the current flight status and target status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should have redundant computing capabilities to ensure that when the primary computing module fails, the backup module can promptly take over and continue calculating the lifting and lowering acceleration duy to guarantee flight safety.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to support the function of switching control modes.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure a smooth transition during the switching of control modes, preventing abrupt changes or instability in the flight status.
The system shall perform privilege verification when switching control modes to ensure that only authorized users or system components can trigger the switch operation.
The system shall record logs of switching operations when changing control modes, including information such as the switching time, operator, and the control modes before and after the switch.
The system should perform a status check when switching control modes to ensure that the new control mode is compatible with the current flight status and environmental conditions.

The system should provide real-time monitoring and alarm mechanisms during control mode switching, in order to promptly notify operators in case of any anomalies occurring during the switching process.

requirement: When the flight altitude is less than 2.1 meters, the given vertical speed automatic correction value vygSemi begins to take effect, and is calculated based on the aircraft's pitch angle using the following formula, then limited to the range [-2, 2].
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure accurate calculation and implementation of the automatic correction value vygSemi for the given vertical speed when the flight altitude is less than 2.1 meters, and shall limit it within the range [−2, 2].

The system should monitor flight altitude in real time to ensure the calculation logic of the automatic correction value vygSemi is correct when the altitude is less than 2.1 meters, and trigger the alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system shall ensure that the pitch angle of the aircraft is considered when calculating the given vertical speed automatic correction value vygSemi, to guarantee that the calculation results meet safety requirements.

The system shall have a real-time consistency checking function for the given vertical speed automatic correction value vygSemi, ensuring its compatibility with the current flight status and pitch angle, and triggering a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: If the inertial navigation acceleration is invalid at this time, the feedback of the lifting acceleration will not be included.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the validity of the inertial acceleration in real time, ensuring that when the inertial acceleration is invalid, the feedback of vertical acceleration is not included in the calculations.
The system should trigger a safety warning mechanism and record relevant logs when it detects invalid inertial navigation acceleration, for subsequent analysis and fault diagnosis.
The system should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that when the inertial navigation acceleration is invalid, other functions of the system are not affected and normal operation is maintained.

requirement: δp = Kp (vg - vk) + f(J), with δp clamped to [3%, 100%]
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the calculated value of δp remains within the clamping range [3%, 100%], and trigger an exception handling mechanism when exceeding the limit.

The system should perform real-time monitoring of the calculation process for δp, ensuring its relationship with the input parameters vg, vk, and J meets expectations, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the calculated value of δp and the result of its limit check for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: vg = Vt + (h - ht)(Vs - Vt) / (hf - ht)
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the validity of input parameters Vt, h, ht, Vs, hf when calculating vg, to prevent calculation errors caused by invalid inputs.
The system should perform real-time validation of the calculated vg to ensure it remains within a reasonable range and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the input parameters and results of each vg calculation to enable traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: If the calculated value of the automatic correction factor vygSemi for lifting speed results in J < 3.5, then the throttle opening δp shall be reduced to zero.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the calculation process of the lifting speed automatic correction amount vygSemi, ensuring that when J < 3.5, the throttle amount δp can be immediately reduced to zero.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism to ensure that the operation of setting the throttle opening δp to zero can be correctly executed when J < 3.5, and trigger an alarm if the operation fails.

requirement: Lateral control is the same as in the second glide segment.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure consistency and accuracy of control logic under the same lateral-directional control and glide slope 2 conditions, preventing control failure or errors caused by logic discrepancies.

The system should monitor the status of lateral control and glide phase 2 in real-time, ensuring synchronization and coordination between them, and promptly trigger the early warning mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.

requirement: Discretization vyg
safety_requirements: When the system discretizes vyg, it should ensure data integrity and accuracy to prevent data loss or errors.
The system should perform real-time monitoring on the discretized vyg data, ensuring it remains within a reasonable range, and trigger an early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record all operations and results during the discretization process to facilitate subsequent auditing and troubleshooting.

requirement: Calculate(k) = vyt + (h(k) - ht)(vyf - vyt)/(hf - ht)
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the validity and accuracy of all input parameters (vyt, h(k), ht, vyf, hf) during the calculation process to prevent abnormal results caused by input errors.
The system should perform real-time validation of calculation results to ensure they fall within reasonable ranges and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting abnormal values.

safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the settings of the notch filter parameters x1z, x2z, wn1z, and wn2z remain consistent between the control law output and the actuator loop to prevent control failure caused by parameter setting errors.

The system should periodically check the values of the notch filter parameters x1z, x2z, wn1z, and wn2z to ensure they have not been modified without authorization during operation, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting anomalies.
The system should provide a parameter validation mechanism to ensure that the notch filter parameters x1z, x2z, wn1z, and wn2z are correctly set upon system startup and restart.

requirement: The specific parameters of the notch filter after the lifting acceleration pre-filter should be configured in the system.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the parameters of the notch filter are configured within valid ranges to prevent system instability or failure due to parameter errors.

The system should have a recovery mechanism in case of incorrect parameter configuration to ensure it can automatically return to a safe state.

requirement: The vertical acceleration in the longitudinal control law during the flare phase needs to be processed through vertical acceleration notch filter 2.
safety_requirements: During the flare phase of the system's longitudinal control law, the vertical acceleration data should be processed through notch filter 2 for vertical acceleration to eliminate interference at specific frequencies, ensuring stability and accuracy of the control law.

The system should perform real-time monitoring on the elevator acceleration data processed by the acceleration notch filter 2, ensuring it remains within a reasonable range, and trigger an early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the aileron channel are x1x = 0.1, x2x = 0.6, wn1x = 24.3, wn2x = 24.3.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the aileron channel notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x remain stable during system startup and operation, preventing unauthorized modifications.

The system should periodically verify the values of the aileron channel notch filter parameters x1x, x2x, wn1x, and wn2x to ensure they are within the allowable error range, in order to guarantee the normal operation of the filter.
The system should have the capability to detect and record abnormal changes in the parameters of the aileron channel notch filter, and trigger an alarm mechanism when abnormalities are detected.

requirement: The notch filter parameters for the rudder channel are x1y = 0.1, x2y = 0.5999922, wn1y = 40.81997, wn2y = 25.11991.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the values of the rudder channel notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y remain accurate during system initialization and operation, preventing the parameters from being tampered with or corrupted.

The system should periodically verify the values of the notch filter parameters x1y, x2y, wn1y, and wn2y in the rudder channel to ensure they remain within the allowable error range, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting anomalies.

safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that all input parameters Kd12, Kd22, Kd01, Kd11, and Kd are within valid ranges when calculating the discrete notch filter formula δd(k), to prevent calculation errors caused by abnormal parameters.

The system should perform real-time monitoring on the output δd(k) of the discretized notch filter to ensure it remains within a reasonable range, and trigger a warning mechanism when abnormal values are detected.
The system should have fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure timely recovery and continued normal operation in case of hardware or software failures during the computing process.

requirement: If the flight altitude is not greater than the decision altitude, phase transition processing is performed based on the current phase flag and flight altitude.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor flight altitude in real time to ensure that when the flight altitude is not greater than the decision height, it can accurately identify and trigger phase transition processing.

When the system is processing phase transitions, it should ensure the integrity and accuracy of the current phase flag and flight altitude data to prevent incorrect phase transitions caused by data errors.
The system should record relevant operation logs during the phase transition process for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

The system should have an exception detection mechanism during the phase transition process, which can promptly trigger an alarm and take corresponding safety measures when abnormalities are detected.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the functionality of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
