When the system performs filtering processing with the lifting acceleration notch filter 2, it should monitor the integrity and accuracy of the input data in real time to ensure the reliability of the filtering results.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that can promptly record anomaly information and trigger an alert mechanism when anomalies occur during the filtering process.

The system should ensure the consistency and stability of the filtering results of the lifting acceleration notch filter 2 under different operating modes, preventing deviations in filtering results caused by mode switching.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the aileron channel, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: When setting notch filter parameters, the system should perform parameter validity verification to ensure that the parameter values are within the valid range, preventing illegal parameters from causing system anomalies.

When the system performs filtering, it should monitor the stability of input signals in real time to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the filtered results, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting abnormal signals.
The system should record detailed logs of the notch filter's parameter settings and filtering process to enable traceability and analysis in case of a failure.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the notch filter function for the rudder channel, including parameter setting and filtering processing.
safety_requirements: When setting the parameters of the notch filter in the rudder channel of the system, ensure the legitimacy and validity of the parameters to prevent system anomalies caused by invalid parameters.

During the filtering process of the rudder channel, the system should monitor the filter status in real time to ensure the accuracy and stability of the filtering results, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.
The system should record key parameters and status information during the filtering process of the rudder channel to facilitate fault diagnosis and post-event analysis.

requirement: The software system needs to implement the Tustin bilinear transform discretization to generate the discrete notch filter formula.
safety_requirements: When the system performs discretization using the Tustin bilinear transformation, it should ensure the validity and legality of input parameters to prevent calculation errors or system crashes caused by illegal inputs.

The system should have a validation mechanism for the discretization results to ensure that the generated notch filter formula meets the expected performance requirements and triggers an alert mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record key operation logs during the discretization process for traceability and analysis in case of issues.

requirement: The system should be able to automatically adjust the flap deflection position based on information provided by the flight phase identification module.
safety_requirements: After receiving information from the flight phase identification module, the system should verify the integrity and validity of the information to ensure that the adjustment commands for the flap deflection position are accurate and error-free.

The system should perform real-time monitoring when adjusting the flap deflection position, ensuring the actual flap position matches the command, and take immediate corrective action upon detecting any deviation.
The system shall have fault detection and diagnostic capabilities, enabling it to detect any abnormalities during flap adjustment and promptly report them to the operator.

The system should record an operation log for each flap adjustment, including the adjustment time, flap positions before and after adjustment, and relevant flight phase information, for subsequent auditing and analysis.

requirement: The system should support manual adjustment of the flap's angular position via remote control.
safety_requirements: When the system manually adjusts the flap deflection position, it should verify the source of the remote control command to ensure that the command comes from an authorized control device.

After receiving a manual adjustment command, the system should perform real-time data validation to ensure that the command parameters are within the safety range, preventing exceeding mechanical limits.
The system should record operation logs, including operation time, operator identity, and adjustment parameters, when manually adjusting the flap deflection position for audit and fault analysis.
The system shall provide real-time feedback when manually adjusting the flap deflection position, ensuring the operator can confirm that the command has been executed correctly.

requirement: The system should be capable of receiving and processing data provided by the flight phase identification module to determine the current flight phase.
safety_requirements: The system shall perform data integrity and validity verification when receiving data provided by the flight phase identification module, ensuring that the data has not been tampered with and conforms to the expected format.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure that data provided by the flight phase identification module is not lost or delayed during transmission, and to trigger an early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system shall ensure the confidentiality of data provided by the flight phase identification module and prevent unauthorized access and disclosure.
The system should record data provided by the flight phase identification module and its processing results to support subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: The system should be able to select the appropriate flap deflection position based on the current flight phase.
safety_requirements: When selecting the flap deflection position, the system should ensure the accuracy of current flight phase data to prevent incorrect flap deflection selection due to data errors.

The system should perform real-time monitoring and verification when selecting flap deflection positions, ensuring the flap deflection position matches the current flight phase, and triggering a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system shall record the selection process and result of each flap deflection position for post-event auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: The system should be capable of recording and displaying the current flap angle position.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy of recorded and displayed current flap angle position data, preventing data loss or tampering.
The system should periodically verify the consistency of flap angle position data to ensure that the displayed data matches the actual position, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should have mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access and modification of flap angle position records, ensuring data confidentiality and integrity.

requirement: Record the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) old values before switching as the softening start point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure data integrity and accuracy when recording the old values of the given attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) before switching, to prevent data loss or tampering.

The system should perform data validation when recording the previous given posture angle value before switching, to ensure data consistency and validity, and prevent abnormal data from affecting system operation.

The system should have a logging function to record the previous value of the given attitude angle before the switch, ensuring that operations are traceable and facilitating fault analysis and auditing.

requirement: During the aircraft's ground waiting phase, the flaps are set to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the flap position is always set to 0° when the aircraft is in the ground waiting phase, and monitor the flap position in real time to prevent accidental movement.
The system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism, which immediately triggers an alarm and records the fault information upon detecting an abnormal flap position.

requirement: When the aircraft begins takeoff, from the start of the ground roll phase, the flaps are deflected to 15°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the command to deflect the flaps to 15° is correctly and reliably transmitted to the flap control system during the aircraft takeoff phase, and perform real-time monitoring during execution.

The system should be equipped with a flap position feedback mechanism to ensure that the actual flap deflection angle matches the command, and trigger a warning mechanism when a deviation is detected.
The system should prohibit flap deflection angles from exceeding 15° during the ground roll phase to prevent flight risks caused by exceeding the safety range.
The system should record logs of flap deflection operations for subsequent safety analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: Start timing when reaching climb segment 1; if the landing gear is retracted within 1 minute, delay for 5 seconds after retraction before retracting flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system starts timing when the aircraft climbs to segment 1. The accuracy and reliability of the timing function must be ensured to prevent timing errors that could lead to delayed or premature retraction of the landing gear and flap operations.

After the landing gear is retracted, the system should accurately time a 5-second delay to ensure the reliability and accuracy of the delay function, preventing flap operation delays or premature actions caused by timing errors.

The system should check the landing gear status and flight status 5 seconds after the landing gear is retracted, to ensure that the operation of retracting the flaps to 0° is performed under safe conditions.

The system should perform the operation of retracting the flaps to 0° with a 5-second delay after the landing gear is retracted, and monitor the flap status in real time to ensure the accuracy and safety of the operation.
The system should record relevant operation logs 5 seconds after the landing gear is retracted, for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: If the landing gear is still not retracted after 1 minute, directly retract the flaps to 0°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of the landing gear in real time, ensuring that if the landing gear is not retracted within 1 minute, it can accurately trigger the command to retract the flaps to 0°.

The system should perform a safety check before executing the operation of retracting the flaps to 0°, to ensure that the current flight condition permits this action and to prevent potential flight risks.
The system should record the historical data of landing gear status and flap operations for fault analysis and traceability in abnormal situations.

requirement: When the aircraft flies to the fourth leg of the five-leg traffic pattern, if the distance to the destination point is less than 1500m, deploy the flaps to 15°.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real-time the distance between the aircraft and the fourth leg of the traffic pattern, ensuring that when the distance is less than 1500m, the command to extend the flaps to 15° is accurately triggered.

After the system triggers the command to extend the flaps to 15°, it shall perform real-time feedback checks to ensure that the actual flap position matches the command, and trigger the warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that when the main system fails, the backup system can promptly take over and execute the command to extend the flaps to 15°.

The system should record the operation log each time the flaps are extended to 15°, including information such as triggering conditions, operation time, flap position, etc., for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: When flying to the fifth side, deploy flaps to 40° when the distance from the intended landing point is less than Hw / tgλ + 1020 m and greater than Hw / tgλ + 20 m.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft is flying to the fifth side, the system should monitor the distance from the predetermined landing point in real time, and ensure that the flaps are accurately extended to 40° when the distance is less than Hw / tgλ + 1020 m and greater than Hw / tgλ + 20 m.

The system should have a redundant monitoring mechanism to ensure that warnings are triggered in a timely manner when distance monitoring anomalies occur, and safety measures are taken to prevent maloperation.
The system should record the time and distance data of flap deployment operations for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: If the aircraft does not enter the glide slope window, the flaps are retracted to 15° (with corresponding changes in Vg) after the aircraft levels off again.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the aircraft's flight status in real time to ensure accurate judgment and execution of altitude hold operations when the aircraft has not entered the glide window.
During the system's execution of the flap retraction to 15°, it should ensure that the change in Vg meets expectations and conduct real-time monitoring to prevent abnormal situations from occurring.
The system should record relevant flight parameters and operation logs when the aircraft is not within the glide path window, for subsequent analysis and audit.
The system should be equipped with fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure safe recovery in case of anomalies during altitude hold and flap retraction operations.

requirement: If the aircraft enters the glide slope window, the flaps remain at 40° until landing is completed.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor in real time whether the aircraft enters the glide window and ensure that the flap angle remains at 40° after entering the glide window until the aircraft is fully landed.

The system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism to ensure that during the flap angle control process, any abnormal conditions (such as a flap angle deviation of 40°) can be promptly detected and trigger the early warning mechanism.
The system should record the entire process of flap angle control, including the time of entering the glide window, changes in flap angle, and landing time, for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: During normal landing, the system begins to extend the flaps to 15° at point A and extends them to 40° at point B; during reverse landing, the system begins to extend the flaps to 15° at point C and extends them to 40° at point D.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the command to extend flaps to 15° at point A and the command to extend flaps to 40° at point B are accurate and error-free during positive landing, while monitoring flap position feedback to ensure flaps respond correctly to commands.

The system shall ensure the accuracy of the command to extend flaps to 15° at point C, and the accuracy of the command to extend flaps to 40° at point D during reverse landing. At the same time, monitor the flap position feedback to ensure the flaps respond correctly according to the commands.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure the accuracy and consistency of flap position sensor data during the flap extension process, preventing erroneous actions caused by sensor failures.

The system should have an anomaly detection and handling mechanism that can promptly trigger warnings and take safety measures to ensure flight safety when anomalies occur during flap deployment or if the flaps fail to deploy properly.

requirement: In remote control mode, when the system receives the "Flap Position 0" command from the remote control, it sends a flap 0° control signal; when receiving the "Flap Position 1" command, it sends a flap 15° control signal; when receiving the "Flap Position 2" command, it sends a flap 40° control signal.
safety_requirements: When the system is in remote control mode, it should validate the received flap position control commands to ensure they are valid and have not been tampered with.

The system should perform real-time status monitoring after receiving flap position control commands to ensure the flap position matches the command, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record an operation log when issuing flap control signals to ensure traceability of operations.

The system in remote control mode should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that when the primary control channel fails, it can switch to the backup channel to continue executing flap control commands.

requirement: When switching between remote control modes with and without an internal loop, record the previous value of the rudder deflection command before switching, as a softening starting point.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between modes with and without inner loop remote control, it should record the previous value of the rudder deflection command before the switch, and ensure the accuracy and integrity of this value to prevent data loss or tampering.

When switching modes, the system should perform a data consistency check to ensure that the recorded previous value of the rudder angle command matches the actual value, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

After switching modes, the system should use the recorded old value of the rudder deflection command as the soft start point to ensure a smooth transition of the system state and prevent instability caused by sudden changes.

requirement: The retraction control of the landing gear is initiated by the landing gear retraction signal and verified by the retraction lock signal. The extension control of the landing gear is initiated by the landing gear extension signal and verified by the extension lock signal. If extension fails, the emergency extension signal can activate the emergency pump.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the uniqueness and immutability of the signals for retracting and extending the landing gear, preventing unauthorized operations.

The system shall initiate the retraction action immediately upon receiving the landing gear retraction signal, and continuously monitor the retraction lock signal during the retraction process to ensure the landing gear is fully retracted and locked.

The system should immediately initiate the landing gear extension action upon receiving the gear-down signal and continuously monitor the gear-down lock signal during the extension process to ensure the landing gear is fully extended and locked.
The system shall automatically trigger an emergency deployment signal and activate the emergency pump upon detecting a failure in gear retraction, ensuring the landing gear can be safely deployed.
The system should record operation logs for each deployment and retraction, including the signal transmission time, operation results, and any anomalies, for subsequent auditing and fault diagnosis.

The system shall be designed with redundancy to ensure that in the event of failure of the primary control system, the backup system can take over and complete the landing gear extension and retraction operations.

requirement: The landing gear can be retracted or deployed in autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control modes. During autonomous control or manual correction, the flight control system automatically retracts or deploys the landing gear based on the aircraft's position, motion, and other information. In remote control mode, the ground control station can issue commands at any time to retract or deploy the landing gear.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure data accuracy and real-time performance when automatically deploying or retracting the landing gear based on aircraft position, movement, and other information in both autonomous control and manual correction modes to prevent incorrect operations.
When the system is in remote control mode, it should ensure that commands issued by the ground control station can be accurately received and executed, preventing command loss or tampering.

When the system switches between different modes, it should perform state synchronization and verification to ensure that the landing gear's extension/retraction status is consistent with the current control mode, preventing misoperations caused by mode switching.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that, when detecting abnormalities in landing gear extension/retraction control, can promptly trigger warnings and implement safety measures, such as automatically switching to a safe mode.

The system shall record all operation logs of landing gear extension and retraction control, including autonomous control, manual correction, and remote control mode operations, for post-event auditing and analysis.

requirement: When the aircraft takes off and reaches the climb phase 1 with the landing gear in the down position, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to high level, and simultaneously send left and right brake signals (brake pressure at 50% FS).
safety_requirements: The system shall verify the signal from the landing gear status sensor when the aircraft takes off and reaches the climb phase 1 with the landing gear in the down position, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the signal.

After the system receives confirmation of the landing gear being in the down position, it should immediately generate and send a landing gear retraction signal, ensure the signal remains at a high logic level, and monitor it in real time to prevent signal loss or errors.

When the system sends the signal to retract the landing gear, it should simultaneously generate and send the left and right brake signals, ensuring that the brake pressure is 50%FS, and conduct real-time monitoring to ensure the accuracy and stability of the signals.

The system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism. During the landing gear extension and retraction process, if any abnormal condition is detected, an alarm should be triggered immediately and fault information recorded.

requirement: After 1s, the system should check the landing gear retraction lock signal. If the retraction lock signal is low, continue to monitor the landing gear extension/retraction status.
safety_requirements: When the system checks the retraction lock signal, it should ensure the accuracy and integrity of the signal to prevent misjudgment that may lead to abnormal landing gear status.
The system should immediately initiate the redundant detection mechanism upon detecting that the retraction lock signal is at a low level, to ensure signal reliability.
The system should record the results of each check on the landing gear retraction and extension status for subsequent analysis and troubleshooting.
The system shall immediately trigger an alarm mechanism and record the abnormal event when detecting an anomaly in the landing gear retraction or extension status.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the down position, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low level, set the left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the landing gear retraction signal is correctly set to low level when the landing gear is detected in the down position, preventing unintended retraction due to misoperation.

The system should ensure that the left and right brake signals are correctly set to 0 when the landing gear is detected in the down position, to prevent abnormal brake signals from damaging the landing gear or causing aircraft instability.

The system should set a landing gear retraction failure flag when it detects that the landing gear is in the down position, ensuring that the failure condition can be promptly identified and addressed.
The system should have a redundancy detection mechanism to ensure accurate and reliable detection of the landing gear status, preventing false judgments caused by sensor failures.
The system should record logs of landing gear status changes for traceability and analysis in case of malfunctions.

requirement: If the landing gear is in the retracted position, the system shall set the landing gear retraction signal to low level and both left and right brake signals to 0.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the landing gear retraction signal is set to a low level when the landing gear is detected in the retracted position, and perform dual confirmation to prevent unintended operation.
The system shall ensure that the left and right brake signals are set to 0 when the landing gear is detected in the retracted position, and perform real-time monitoring to prevent signal anomalies.
The system should have a fault detection mechanism that triggers an alarm and records a fault log when the landing gear status detection fails.
The system should be designed with redundancy to ensure that it can still correctly execute the setting of landing gear retraction signals and brake signals in the event of a single-point failure.

requirement: If the retraction lock signal is high, the system should periodically check the retraction lock signal.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the high-level state of the retracted lock signal is not misjudged as a low level during detection, in order to prevent maloperation.
The system should periodically check the high-level state of the retract lock signal and immediately trigger the alarm mechanism upon detecting a low-level signal to ensure timely response.
The system should record the detection results of each retracted lock signal for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: If the uplock signal transitions to low level within 1 minute, the system shall set the landing gear retraction signal to low level, set both left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear status to retracted.
safety_requirements: After the system receives the low-level retraction lock signal, it should complete the operation of setting the landing gear retraction signal to low level within 1 minute, ensuring the timeliness and accuracy of the operation.
After the system receives the low-level signal for retracting and locking, it should set the left and right brake signals to 0 within 1 minute, ensuring timely and accurate operation.

After the system receives the retraction lock signal turning to low level, it should update the landing gear status to retracted within 1 minute and ensure the timeliness and accuracy of the status update.

The system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism. If the retract lock signal transitions to a low level and the aforementioned operation is not completed within 1 minute, a fault alarm should be triggered and logged.
The system shall ensure that all relevant signal and status changes during the landing gear retraction process are recorded for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: If the uplock signal remains high after 1 minute, the system should set the landing gear retraction signal to low, set both left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction failure flag.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of the retraction lock signal in real time, ensuring that if the signal remains high after 1 minute, it can accurately set the landing gear retraction signal to low, set both left and right brake signals to 0, and set the landing gear retraction fault flag.
The system should trigger a fault warning mechanism, record a fault log, and notify maintenance personnel after detecting the retracted lock signal at a high level for one minute.

The system should perform a dual confirmation when setting the landing gear retraction signal to low level and both left and right brake signals to 0, to ensure the accuracy and reliability of signal transmission.
After the system sets the landing gear retraction fault flag, it should prohibit further operation of the landing gear until the fault is cleared and the system is reset.

requirement: When the aircraft returns to the third leg of the five-leg traffic pattern and the distance to the destination is less than 5000m, the system shall set both left and right brakes to 100% and raise the landing gear signal to high level.
safety_requirements: The system shall immediately verify that the left and right brakes are set to 100% and the landing gear deployment signal is set to high level when detecting that the aircraft returns to the third leg of the five-leg traffic pattern and the distance to the destination point is less than 5000m, ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of the commands.

The system should monitor the status of the left and right brake and landing gear signals in real time, ensuring that after command execution, both left and right brakes are indeed set to 100% and the landing gear signal is set to high level, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record operation logs each time the left and right brakes are set to 100% and the landing gear deployment signal is set to high level, for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: The flight control and management software needs to implement electrical equipment management.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the management functions of electrical equipment can operate normally under any circumstances, preventing equipment abnormalities or failures caused by the failure of management functions.
The system should provide real-time monitoring and alarm mechanisms for the status of electrical equipment to ensure timely notification of operators in case of equipment abnormalities.

The system should have fault diagnosis and recovery functions for electrical equipment, ensuring quick identification of issues and restoration of normal equipment operation in the event of a failure.
The system should record the operating logs of electrical equipment, including equipment status changes, operation records, and fault information for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: When switching between remote control modes with the inner loop, record the previous set attitude angles (roll, yaw, and pitch) as the soft start reference.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between remote control modes with in-band loops, it should ensure the accuracy of the recorded previous attitude angle (roll, yaw, and pitch) values before switching, to prevent data loss or errors.

When the system switches modes, it should perform data integrity and consistency checks to ensure that the recorded previous values of the specified attitude angles are consistent with the actual state.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism. When switching modes, if the recorded previous value of the given attitude angle shows anomalies, an alarm should be triggered immediately and a log should be recorded.

requirement: The system should check the unlock signal after 1s.
safety_requirements: After 1 second, the system checks the unlock signal and should ensure the integrity and validity of the signal to prevent it from being tampered with or lost.

The system should perform real-time status monitoring when checking the unlock signal after 1s, to ensure the signal is consistent with the current system status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: If the landing gear unlock signal is low, indicating a fault in the landing gear deployment circuit, then set the emergency landing gear deployment signal to high. After one minute, set both the landing gear deployment and emergency deployment signals to low (in this case, the unlock signal cannot be checked), set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, and activate the landing gear deployment fault flag.
safety_requirements: The system should detect the low-level signal of the landing gear extension circuit, ensuring that when a low-level signal is detected, the emergency landing gear extension signal is immediately set to high level, and after 1 minute, both the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals are set to low level.
The system shall record the occurrence time of a landing gear circuit fault and, after the fault flag is set to active, generate a fault log and trigger the alarm mechanism.

After the emergency landing gear deployment signal is set to high level, the system shall ensure that the left and right brakes are set to the corresponding preset values to guarantee the safe landing of the aircraft in case of landing gear failure.

The system should periodically check the status of the landing gear deployment and emergency landing gear deployment signals to ensure they are within the normal operating range, and immediately trigger the fault handling mechanism upon detecting any anomaly.

requirement: If the gear down lock signal is high, periodically check the gear down lock signal: if the gear down lock signal becomes low within 1 minute, it indicates that the landing gear has been deployed; set the gear down signal to low, set the landing gear status to down, set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values, and set the landing gear deployment failure flag to invalid.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when the detection of the lock release signal is at a high level, it periodically checks the signal's voltage state to ensure detection frequency and accuracy.

After the system detects that the landing gear lock-down signal has changed from high level to low level, it should confirm within 1 minute that the landing gear is down, set the landing gear deployment signal to low level, and set the landing gear status to down.

After confirming that the landing gear has been deployed, the system should set the left and right brakes to the corresponding pre-set values to ensure the correctness and safety of the landing gear status.
After confirming that the landing gear has been deployed, the system should set the landing gear deployment failure flag to invalid, ensuring the accuracy and timely update of the failure flag.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism. If the lock signal does not transition to a low level within 1 minute, a fault alarm should be triggered and logged.

requirement: If the gear down lock signal is high, periodically check the gear down lock signal: if the gear down lock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates a landing gear extension fault; then set the emergency landing gear extension signal to high, and after 1 second, periodically check the gear down lock signal.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when the unlock detection signal is high, it periodically checks the signal to ensure the accuracy and consistency of its status.

The system should immediately trigger a landing gear release fault warning and set the emergency landing gear release signal to high level when it detects that the lock-down signal remains at high level for 1 minute.
After setting the emergency landing gear deployment signal to high level, the system shall continue to periodically check the downlock signal to ensure continuous monitoring of its status.

The system should have fault detection and recording capabilities to ensure that when a landing gear deployment fault occurs, relevant events and timestamps can be recorded for subsequent analysis and handling.
The system shall ensure timely response and execution of the emergency landing gear deployment operation after the emergency landing gear signal is set to high level, to ensure flight safety.

requirement: If the unlock signal remains high after 1 minute, it indicates a failure in the emergency landing gear deployment. Both the landing gear deployment and emergency deployment signals are set to low, the left and right brakes are set to their respective preset values, and the landing gear deployment fault flag is activated.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the status of the downlock signal in real time, ensuring that if the signal remains high after one minute, it correctly identifies a failure in the emergency landing gear deployment and triggers the corresponding fault handling mechanism.

The system shall immediately set the landing gear extension and emergency landing gear extension signals to low level upon detecting a failure in the emergency landing gear extension, ensuring consistency and safety of the system status.

When the system detects a failure in the emergency landing gear deployment, it shall set the left and right brakes to their respective preset values to ensure safe control of the aircraft in emergency situations.

The system shall set the landing gear deployment failure flag to active and record relevant fault information when detecting a failure in emergency landing gear deployment, for subsequent fault analysis and handling.

requirement: If the lock release signal goes low within 1 minute, it indicates that the emergency landing gear deployment is successful. After a 2-second delay, both the landing gear deployment and emergency deployment signals are set to low level, the landing gear status is set to deployed, the left and right brakes are set to their respective preset values, and the landing gear deployment fault flag is set to invalid.
safety_requirements: The system should detect the level status of the lock release signal within 1 minute, ensure it becomes low level, confirm successful emergency landing gear deployment, and after a 2-second delay, set both the landing gear deployment and emergency landing gear deployment signals to low level.

The system should ensure that after a successful emergency landing gear extension, the landing gear status is correctly set to down, and the left and right brakes are set to their respective preset values.
The system should set the landing gear deployment fault flag to invalid after a successful emergency landing gear extension and record the operation in the log.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure that if the lock signal does not go low within one minute, a fault alarm mechanism is triggered and related fault information is recorded.

The system shall ensure that all relevant signal and status changes are completed within the specified time after a successful emergency landing gear extension to guarantee the safety and reliability of the system.

requirement: During ground power-up, the system should initialize all signals and statuses to ensure the correct initial state of the landing gear and braking systems.
safety_requirements: When the system is powered on the ground, all signals and status initial values should be verified to ensure the initial states of the landing gear and braking systems are correct and error-free.
During the system initialization process, all initial values of signals and statuses should be recorded, and an alarm mechanism should be triggered when abnormalities are detected.

After the system initialization is completed, it should perform a self-test to ensure the functions of the landing gear and brake system are normal, and prohibit system operation if the self-test fails.

requirement: Set the landing gear status to down.
safety_requirements: When the system sets the landing gear status to down, it should verify the feedback signal from the landing gear status sensor to ensure the landing gear is indeed in the down position.
When the system sets the landing gear status to down, it should record an operation log, including operation time, operator, and operation result, for subsequent audit and fault analysis.
When the system sets the landing gear status to down, it should check system permissions to ensure that only authorized personnel can perform this operation.
When the system sets the landing gear status to down, it should monitor for anomalies during the landing gear deployment process and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting any anomaly.

requirement: Remote control commands for extending or retracting the landing gear can be issued in any control mode as required.
safety_requirements: The system shall perform authentication when sending remote control commands to deploy or retract the landing gear in any control mode, to ensure the legitimacy of the command source.

When the system sends remote control commands to deploy or retract the landing gear, it should perform data integrity verification to ensure that the commands have not been tampered with during transmission.
When the system receives remote control commands to extend or retract the landing gear, it should perform an authorization check to ensure the command sender has the appropriate permissions.
The system shall record operation logs when executing remote control commands for extending or retracting the landing gear, to ensure traceability of operations.

The system shall perform real-time status monitoring when executing remote control commands for landing gear deployment and retraction, ensuring the landing gear actions meet expectations, and triggering an alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Upon receiving the "Retract Landing Gear" remote command, if the flight phase is not ground waiting and the flight altitude is no less than 80m, proceed as per item 1) in Section 3.2.11.3 (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: When the system receives the remote command "Retract landing gear", it should verify whether the current flight phase is ground waiting, to ensure that this command is not executed during the ground waiting phase.
When the system receives the remote command "Retract landing gear", it shall check whether the current flight altitude is not less than 80m to ensure the command is executed at a safe altitude.
The system shall follow the processing steps in 3.2.11.3 item 1) when execution conditions are met, to ensure the accuracy and safety of instruction execution.

During the execution of the "retract landing gear" command, the system should monitor the flight status in real time to ensure timely termination of the operation and triggering of the warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: When switching between the inner loop remote control and non-inner loop remote control modes, record the previous value of the rudder deflection command before switching as the soft start point.
safety_requirements: When the system switches between in-band loop remote control and non-in-band loop remote control modes, it should ensure that the previous rudder deflection command value before the switch is accurately recorded as the soft start point, to prevent loss or error of the rudder deflection command during the switching process.

During the mode transition process, the system should monitor the continuity and consistency of rudder command in real time, ensure smooth transition without abnormal jumps, and trigger the warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies.

requirement: When receiving the remote control command "Lower Landing Gear", proceed as per the handling described in 3.2.11.3 item 2) (excluding its conditions).
safety_requirements: When the system receives a remote control command to "deploy landing gear," it should verify the integrity and source of the command to ensure that the command has not been tampered with and originates from an authorized control source.

Before executing the remote control command "Extend Landing Gear", the system shall perform a status check to ensure that the current flight status permits execution of this operation, preventing extension of the landing gear under unsafe conditions.

When the system executes the remote control command "Lower Landing Gear", it should record an operation log including the command receiving time, execution time, and operation result for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

During the execution of the remote command "Deploy Landing Gear", the system shall monitor the landing gear status in real-time to ensure it operates as intended, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Each of the two rear wheels of the aircraft has an independent braking system. The braking system uses a PWM control scheme. The flight control computer sends a 2 kHz pulse width modulated signal to the braking system, where the brake torque is proportional to the duty cycle of the PWM signal. The duration of braking corresponds to the duration of the PWM signal.
safety_requirements: The flight control computer should perform signal integrity checks before sending PWM signals to ensure that the signals are free from distortion or interference, in order to guarantee the accuracy and reliability of braking torque.

The brake system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism to monitor the duty cycle and duration of the PWM signal in real time, ensuring they remain within preset limits, and triggering an alarm or safety measures in case of anomalies.

The brake system should be designed with redundancy to ensure that in the event of a failure in one brake system, the other brake system can independently perform the braking task and guarantee aircraft safety.

The communication between the flight control computer and the braking system should have an encryption mechanism to prevent unauthorized access or tampering, ensuring the safety of signal transmission.

The response time of the braking system shall meet safety requirements, ensuring that the braking action can be completed within the specified time after receiving the PWM signal to cope with emergency situations.

requirement: Apply maximum brake torque to both wheels simultaneously before takeoff to prevent the aircraft from sliding; this is known as static braking.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the brake torque of both wheels reaches the maximum value before takeoff to prevent aircraft movement and ensure the reliability of the static braking function.
The system should monitor the brake torque status of both wheels in real time, ensuring it remains at maximum value before takeoff and triggering a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should have the function of preventing misoperation to ensure that the parking brake status is not accidentally released before takeoff.
The system should record the brake torque status before takeoff to verify the effectiveness of the static brake function during post-event analysis.

requirement: During ground taxiing, a larger braking torque is applied to one main wheel while a smaller braking torque is applied to the other main wheel based on the aircraft's lateral deviation from the runway centerline in order to correct the lateral deviation. This is referred to as differential braking.
safety_requirements: During the ground rollout process, the system shall monitor in real time the lateral deviation distance of the aircraft from the runway centerline to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the lateral deviation data.

The system should dynamically adjust the braking torque of the main wheels based on the lateral offset data, ensuring that one main wheel generates a larger braking torque while the other generates a smaller braking torque, in order to correct the lateral offset.

The system should be equipped with a fault detection mechanism that can promptly issue an alarm and take safety measures to prevent aircraft loss of control when a fault occurs in the main wheel braking system.
The system should record the execution log of the differential braking, including side offset data, brake torque adjustment status, and system response time, for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: After the landing rollout speed decreases to a certain value, in order to reduce the rollout distance, equal braking torque is simultaneously applied to both main wheels, which is referred to as dynamic braking.
safety_requirements: After the landing roll speed decreases to a certain value, the system should ensure that both main wheels apply the same braking torque simultaneously to reduce the rollout distance and prevent safety hazards caused by excessive rollout distance.

The system should monitor the braking torque of the two main wheels in real time to ensure consistency and stability, and immediately trigger a warning mechanism and take corresponding safety measures upon detecting any abnormality.

The system should have fault detection and diagnosis capabilities to ensure that during the braking process, any fault in the main wheel brake system can be promptly identified and addressed, preventing increased ground roll distance caused by a single main wheel failure.

requirement: If the full compression signal of the landing gear is valid and the airspeed is less than a certain speed threshold vk_may_brake, differential braking is used for course correction.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the validity of the landing gear full compression signal to ensure its authenticity and reliability, preventing unintended activation of differential braking.

The system should activate the differential braking correction function when the landing gear full compression signal is valid and the airspeed is less than the speed threshold vk_may_brake, and ensure the correctness and timeliness of this function.

The system should monitor airspeed in real time to ensure that the differential braking correction function is not activated when the airspeed exceeds the threshold value vk_may_brake, preventing unintended operations.
The system should record logs for the activation and deactivation of the differential braking correction function for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: In autonomous control mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -(Kz * Dz + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy)
safety_requirements: The system in autonomous control mode shall ensure the accurate calculation of the differential braking control law δb = -(Kz * Dz + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy), and the calculation result shall remain as expected when parameters Kz, K, Ky, Dz, Δy, and wy change.

The system should monitor in real time the calculation results of the differential brake control law to ensure their consistency with the current flight status and control parameters, and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies.

The system should have redundant computing capabilities to ensure that when the primary computing unit fails, the backup computing unit can seamlessly take over the calculation tasks of the differential brake control law.

requirement: In manual correction mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = -[Kz * (Dz - DzgSemi - DzsemiOld) + Kz * Dz - K * Δy - Ky * wy], where DzsemiOld is the lateral offset correction value during the flare segment.
safety_requirements: When the system is in manual correction mode, it shall ensure the accurate values of calculation parameters Kz, Dz, DzgSemi, DzsemiOld, K, Δy, Ky, and wy for the differential brake control law, to prevent calculation errors caused by parameter inaccuracies.

The system should monitor the calculation result δb of the differential brake control law in real time, ensure that it stays within a reasonable range, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the calculation process and results of each differential brake control law to facilitate fault diagnosis and post-event analysis.

requirement: In the attitude remote control (attitude control) mode, the differential brake control law is: δb = K * (-yg) + Ky * wy
safety_requirements: In the in-band loop remote control mode, the system shall ensure accurate calculation of the differential brake control law δb = K * (-yg) + Ky * wy, and the calculation results shall correctly reflect the current flight status even when parameters K, yg, and wy change.

The system should monitor in real-time the calculation process of the differential brake control law to ensure its consistency with the current flight status and target status, and immediately trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.

The system should have a redundant mechanism to ensure that when the primary computing module fails, the backup module can seamlessly take over the calculation of the differential brake control law, ensuring flight safety.

requirement: When a phase transition occurs or a control mode switch related to the remote control mode takes place, record the previous value of the throttle deflection command before the transition as the softening start point.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the previous value of the throttle position command before the phase transition or control mode switch is recorded, and verify the accuracy of the recorded data.

When the system transitions between phases or switches control modes, it should ensure that the previously recorded throttle bias command value is used as the starting point for smoothing, to prevent control anomalies caused by data loss or errors.
The system shall monitor the throttle valve deflection command changes in real time during phase transitions or control mode switches, and trigger a warning mechanism upon detecting anomalies.

requirement: In the non-internal-loop remote control (control surface remote control) mode, the specific formula for the differential braking control law is not provided, but the corresponding control logic needs to be implemented.
safety_requirements: In the non-internal-loop remote control mode, the system should ensure the correctness and reliability of the differential braking control logic to prevent unauthorized control commands from interfering with system operation.

The system should monitor in real time the execution status of the differential braking control logic to ensure its consistency with the current flight status and operational commands, and immediately trigger the safety mechanism upon detecting any anomaly.
The system should record the execution process and results of the differential brake control logic to provide detailed log information for fault analysis and auditing.

requirement: During the ground waiting phase, the differential brake control law under autonomous and manual correction modes is: δb = 0.
safety_requirements: During the ground waiting phase, the system should ensure that the differential brake control law δb = 0 in both autonomous and manual correction modes to prevent unauthorized modifications.

During the ground waiting phase, the system should monitor the value of the differential brake control law δb in real time to ensure that it remains 0 at all times, and trigger an alarm mechanism upon detecting any anomaly.

requirement: In remote control mode, it is the same as during the taxi phase, where vk_may_brake = 80 km/h.
safety_requirements: In remote control mode, the system should monitor the taxiing speed in real time to ensure that the braking function is properly activated when the speed reaches or exceeds 80 km/h, preventing the risk of overspeed.
In remote control mode, the system should have a redundant monitoring mechanism to ensure the accuracy of taxiing speed measurement data and trigger a warning mechanism in case of data anomalies.
In remote control mode, the system should record taxiing speed and braking status for post-analysis and troubleshooting.

requirement: If the full gear compression signal is valid and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, then δb = 0.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the validity of the landing gear full compression signal in real time, ensuring that δb remains 0 when the signal is valid and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake.

The system should have the capability to perform dual verification of the δb value when the landing gear full compression signal is valid and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, ensuring its correctness.

The system shall record relevant status and calculation results when the landing gear full compression signal is valid and the airspeed is not less than vk_may_brake, for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: δb is limited within [-XfB, XfB]. XfB is the maximum proportional braking amount, which can be set via remote control, with a default value of 40%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the value of δb is always limited within the range [ -XfB, XfB ] to prevent exceeding the maximum proportional braking amount, thereby avoiding any impact on flight safety.

The system should provide the function to remotely set XfB, and perform validity verification during the setting to ensure that the input value is within a reasonable range, with a default value of 40%.

The system should monitor the value of δb in real time, and once it detects that the value exceeds the amplitude limit, it should immediately trigger a safety mechanism, such as stopping the braking action or activating an alarm.

requirement: The adopted differential braking correction method is differential proportional braking (referred to as proportional braking).
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and timeliness of brake commands during differential proportional braking to prevent flight deviations caused by command errors or delays.

The system should monitor the execution result of the differential proportional braking in real time to ensure that it is consistent with the expected correction effect, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should have a redundant mechanism for differential proportional braking to ensure that the backup system can take over in time when the primary braking system fails, guaranteeing flight safety.

requirement: If δb < 0, then δbL = -δb + YzBL + YjB, δbR = YzBL + YjB; otherwise δbL = YzBL + YjB, δbR = δb + YzBR + YjB.
safety_requirements: When calculating δbL and δbR, the system shall ensure the correct value of δb is used, and correctly perform the calculations δbL = -δb + YzBL + YjB and δbR = YzBL + YjB when δb < 0.
The system shall ensure the correct value of δb when calculating δbL and δbR, and properly perform the calculations δbL = YzBL + YjB and δbR = δb + YzBR + YjB when δb ≥ 0.

The system should perform real-time consistency checks on the calculated δbL and δbR to ensure their values match with δb, YzBL, YzBR, and YjB, and trigger an early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: YzBL and YzBR are the left and right brake presets, which can be set via remote control, with a default value of 10%.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the set values of YzBL and YzBR are within the valid range, preventing them from exceeding the preset maximum and minimum values, in order to avoid brake system failure or anomalies.

The system should provide mechanisms to verify the YzBL and YzBR values of remote control settings, ensuring they are consistent with the current flight status and system safety requirements, and trigger an alarm when illegal settings are detected.
The system should record the setting history of YzBL and YzBR for traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.

requirement: YjB is the emergency brake bias, which is 0 under normal conditions and 30% when the link is interrupted.
safety_requirements: Under normal conditions, the system should ensure that the value of YjB is 0, and automatically switch to a 30% emergency brake bias when the link is interrupted.
The system should monitor the link status in real time, ensuring immediate adjustment of the YjB value upon link interruption and automatic reset to 0 after link recovery.
The system should record the time points of link interruption and recovery, and generate corresponding logs for subsequent analysis and audit.
The system should have a fault detection and alarm mechanism, which immediately triggers an alarm and notifies relevant personnel when the link is interrupted.
