safety_requirements: During the system solution process, it should be ensured that the calculated value of max(δbL, δbR) does not exceed 1 to prevent control surface deflection from going beyond the safe range.

The system shall perform real-time monitoring of the calculation result of max(δbL, δbR). Once it detects that the value exceeds the safety range, it shall immediately trigger the safety mechanism, stop the related operations, and record the abnormal log.

requirement: The autonomous control function must have flight control capability.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that autonomous control functions accurately monitor the flight status and execute control commands without error during startup and operation, preventing unauthorized interference.

The system should have the capability to monitor flight status in real time, ensuring that timely safety measures can be taken in abnormal situations, such as automatically switching to backup control mode or triggering an emergency landing.

The system should have fault detection and diagnosis capabilities to ensure timely identification and reporting when autonomous control functions fail, while also implementing corresponding safety measures.
The system shall ensure the confidentiality and integrity of commands and data during the transmission process of autonomous control functions, preventing data from being tampered with or leaked.

requirement: The specific softening time should be determined according to control requirements, actual needs, and previous control experience.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that the softening time setting meets the control requirements to prevent system instability or safety risks caused by improper settings.
The system should record each setting and modification of the softening time to ensure traceability, facilitating analysis and recovery in case of anomalies.
The system should provide a verification mechanism for the softening time setting to ensure its rationality and effectiveness, preventing safety issues caused by misoperation.

requirement: During the phase transition, it is necessary to initialize the integrator in the control law of the new phase to ensure proper control of the aircraft to achieve the desired control effect.
safety_requirements: When the system transitions between phases, the integrator in the control law for the new phase should be initialized to ensure that its initial value meets the desired control performance.

The system should verify the correctness of integrator initialization during phase transitions, ensure that the initialized integrator values match the expected values, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

After the phase transition, the system should monitor the integrator's operating status in real-time to ensure its stability during the control process and take corresponding safety measures when abnormalities are detected.

requirement: Phase transition processing in non-remote control mode is carried out step by step under autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes as follows.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure correct logic for transitioning between autonomous control, manual correction, and command control modes under non-remote control mode, preventing illegal or unauthorized mode switching.

When the system is not in remote control mode, it should monitor status parameters under each mode in real time to ensure data integrity and consistency during phase transitions, preventing data loss or tampering.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism in non-remote control mode, capable of detecting abnormal conditions during phase transitions and promptly triggering warnings or protective measures to ensure system safety.

requirement: The transition into and out of the ground waiting phase is made more reliable through a two-out-of-three switching command selection.
safety_requirements: During the transition into and out of the ground waiting phase, the system should ensure the correct three-out-of-two logic for switching commands to prevent errors in system status caused by misoperations.

The system should monitor the status of switching commands in real time to ensure that the execution result of the two-out-of-three logic is consistent with expectations, and trigger an alarm mechanism when abnormalities are detected.
The system should record the execution logs of switch commands for fault analysis and traceability in case of anomalies.

requirement: The transition conditions for other phases should be determined through multiple evaluations based on specific circumstances, and phase transitions should only occur when five consecutive evaluations yield consistent results, in order to reduce the probability of misjudgment.
safety_requirements: The system should continuously check the consistency of transition conditions five times before performing a phase transition, ensuring the accuracy and reliability of each judgment result.
The system should record the result of each judgment to enable traceability and analysis in case of anomalies.
The system shall trigger an exception handling mechanism when it detects five consecutive inconsistent judgment results, to prevent phase transitions caused by misjudgment.
The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure timely detection and response to abnormal situations during the evaluation process.

requirement: After the flight control computer is powered on the ground or the aircraft is fully landed and the flight control pre-shutdown command is issued, it enters the ground waiting phase.
safety_requirements: The system shall perform a self-check when the flight control computer is powered on the ground, ensuring all critical components and communication links are functioning normally before entering the ground waiting phase.

After the system receives the command indicating the aircraft has fully landed and the flight control pre-shutdown instruction, it should verify the validity and source of the command to prevent misoperation that could cause the system to prematurely enter the ground waiting phase.
During the ground waiting phase, the system should continuously monitor critical parameters and status to ensure timely response and appropriate actions in case of anomalies.

requirement: During the ground taxiing phase (including takeoff and landing roll), after receiving a ground hold command remotely, the system transitions to the ground hold phase.
safety_requirements: After receiving the ground waiting command from the remote control, the system should verify the integrity and validity of the command to ensure that the command has not been tampered with or corrupted.

Before the system enters the ground waiting phase, it should confirm that the current flight status meets the conditions for ground waiting, to avoid entering the ground waiting phase in an unsuitable state.

The system should continuously monitor the flight status and environmental parameters during the ground holding phase to ensure timely exit from the ground holding phase and implementation of safety measures in case of anomalies.
The system should record all relevant operations and status changes during the ground waiting phase for subsequent auditing and fault analysis.

requirement: When max(δbL, δbR) > 100%, if δbL ≥ δbR, set δbR = δbR - (δbL - 100), δbL = 100%; if δbR > δbL, set δbL = δbL - (δbR - 100), δbR = 100%. This ensures the left and right brakes meet the differential travel requirement.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the values of δbL and δbR in real time to ensure they do not exceed 100%, and automatically adjust δbL and δbR when they exceed 100% to meet the differential requirements.

The system shall ensure accurate calculation results when adjusting the values of δbL and δbR, and maintain system stability during the adjustment process to prevent system failures caused by calculation errors.
The system should record each event where δbL and δbR exceed 100%, and generate logs for subsequent analysis and auditing.
The system should have an abnormality detection mechanism that can promptly trigger an alarm and take corresponding safety measures when the values of δbL and δbR are abnormal.

requirement: The brake command issued by the remote control has the highest priority. Regardless of the current control mode, when a "brake" command is received, the aircraft will superimpose the full brake value onto the left and right brake control outputs respectively, followed by over-limit processing. The full brake value can be remotely set, with a default value of 80%.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that upon receiving a "brake" command in any control mode, it immediately executes a full braking operation, with the full braking amount not less than the preset value (default is 80%), and performs over-limit processing.
The system shall perform real-time verification of the received "brake" command to ensure the integrity and validity of the command, preventing misoperation or malicious attacks.

The system should monitor the status of the brake system in real-time after performing a braking operation, ensure the success of the braking action, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of abnormalities.
The system should record the time, mode, and amount of each braking operation for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: When receiving the "release brake" command, braking is performed according to the calculated left and right brake amounts (i.e., without superimposing the full brake amount). At this time, if the calculated brake amount δb is 0, both left and right brakes take the corresponding brake preset values.
safety_requirements: When the system receives a "release brake" command, it should verify the source and validity of the command to ensure that the command has not been tampered with or forged.
When the system calculates a brake amount δb of 0, it should automatically apply a pre-set brake amount and log this operation for subsequent audit and fault diagnosis.

The system shall monitor the status of the braking system in real-time during brake operations, ensure that the braking actions are executed as intended, and immediately trigger safety mechanisms, such as emergency stop, upon detecting any abnormal conditions.
The system should perform redundant calculations when determining the brake output to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the results, preventing malfunctions caused by single-point failures.

requirement: The flight control system generates necessary commands in real time based on the collected aircraft input information and according to specified regulations or mathematical description models, controlling relevant equipment to make the aircraft fly in the desired manner.
safety_requirements: The flight control system shall ensure the integrity and accuracy of data when receiving and processing aircraft input information, preventing data from being tampered with or lost.

The flight control system shall perform real-time verification when generating control commands to ensure that the commands comply with safety regulations and meet the requirements of the mathematical description model.
The flight control system should be equipped with fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure that timely measures can be taken upon detecting anomalies, preventing loss of aircraft control.
The flight control system shall record the generation and execution process of all control commands for auditing and traceability when required.
The flight control system should have authentication and authorization mechanisms to ensure that only authorized personnel can access and modify control parameters.

requirement: When receiving a vehicle command or a brake release command, the left and right brake control quantities are taken as the left and right ground inspection brake quantities, respectively.
safety_requirements: When the system receives a vehicle command or a brake release command, it should ensure that the left and right brake control quantities accurately take the respective ground inspection brake quantities to prevent misoperation or data errors.

The system shall perform real-time data validation upon receiving a vehicle command or a brake release command, ensuring the reasonable and consistent values of the left and right ground inspection brake quantities to prevent safety risks caused by abnormal conditions.

The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism when receiving vehicle commands or brake release commands. If data anomalies or command conflicts are detected, it should immediately trigger a warning and take safety measures.

requirement: Upon receiving the flight control pre-shutdown command, set the left and right brake control values to 0, i.e., clear the left and right brake presets.
safety_requirements: After the system receives the flight control pre-shutdown command, it should immediately clear the left and right brake presets to ensure that the brake control value is 0, preventing unintended brake actions.

After clearing the preset values of the left and right brakes, the system should perform a status confirmation to ensure that the brake control amount is indeed zero, and record the log of the clearing operation.
After receiving the flight control pre-shutdown command, the system should verify the source and integrity of the command to ensure it has not been tampered with or forged.

After the system clears the preset values of the left and right brakes, it should trigger the safety monitoring mechanism to monitor the status of the brake system in real time, ensuring that the system remains in a safe state.

requirement: Brake command processing is performed only during ground waiting, takeoff roll, and landing roll phases.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that brake commands are only processed during ground waiting, takeoff roll, and landing roll phases, and should not respond to brake commands during other flight phases.

The system should monitor the flight status in real time to ensure that when a brake command is received during non-designated flight phases, it can immediately detect anomalies and trigger the warning mechanism.
The system should record the processing time of each brake command and the flight status for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: When retracting the landing gear, both left and right brake quantities are set to 50%; when extending the landing gear, both left and right brake quantities are set to 100%. At the end of landing gear retraction, both left and right brake quantities are set to 0%; at the end of landing gear extension, both left and right brake quantities are set to the preset value.
safety_requirements: When the system retracts the landing gear, it should ensure that both left and right brake quantities are set to 50%, and at the end of the landing gear retraction, both left and right brake quantities should be set to 0% to prevent flight safety issues caused by accidental braking.

When the system is lowering the landing gear, it should ensure that both left and right brake quantities are set to 100%, and at the end of the landing gear deployment, both left and right brake quantities should be set to the preset amount to ensure the stability and safety of the landing gear.

The system should monitor the landing gear status and brake quantity in real time, ensure accurate brake quantity setting during landing gear extension/retraction, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system should be equipped with fault detection and recovery mechanisms to ensure that, in the event of a failure during landing gear extension or retraction, timely measures can be taken to prevent flight accidents.

requirement: When an aircraft is landing, if the conditions for a safe landing are not met and the landing continues, it may affect the safety of the landing. To enhance the safety of aircraft landing, a go-around function is provided to allow the aircraft to adjust its flight status and land again.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the aircraft's flight status in real-time during return and landing, ensuring all safety landing conditions are met. If the conditions are not satisfied, the go-around function should be triggered immediately.

The system should have a go-around function, capable of automatically adjusting the flight status and re-planning the landing path when safety landing conditions are not met, ensuring safe go-around of the aircraft.
The system should record the triggering and execution process of the go-around function for subsequent analysis and audit.
The system should have fault detection and diagnosis capabilities, able to detect any anomalies during the go-around process and take timely measures to ensure aircraft safety.

requirement: The method of setting integrator initial value softening is adopted.
safety_requirements: When setting the initial value of the integrator, the system should ensure the accuracy of the initial value to prevent abnormal system behavior caused by incorrect initial values.
The system should have the capability to detect and correct integrator initial value errors, ensuring timely recovery to the correct state in case of incorrect initial value settings.
The system should record the entire process of setting the integrator initial value to enable traceability and analysis in case of abnormalities.

requirement:
When both conditions 1) and 2) below are met, execute the go-around command:  
1) Flight altitude is higher than decision altitude (40m). If the control mode is not remote control, it must also meet the condition of being on the glide path.  
2) Received flight switch command: "Go-around".
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when the flight altitude is higher than the decision height (40m) and the control mode is not remote control, it checks whether the glide state has been entered, ensuring the accuracy and real-time performance of the status information.
The system should authenticate and authorize the received flight switch command "Go Around" to ensure the legitimacy and validity of the command source.

The system should monitor flight altitude and control mode status in real time to ensure timely execution of a go-around command when go-around conditions are met, and to trigger an alert mechanism in abnormal situations.
The system should record the execution log of the go-around command, including the command source, execution time, and flight status, for subsequent audit and analysis.

requirement: If the aircraft is in autonomous control mode, directly control the aircraft to perform a go-around. If the aircraft is not in autonomous control mode, automatically switch to autonomous control mode first, then control the aircraft to perform a go-around. The smoothing method for mode transition is the same as the smoothing method during mode change.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that during autonomous control mode, all control commands are executed accurately and without error when directly controlling the aircraft to perform a go-around, ensuring flight safety.

The system should automatically switch to autonomous control mode when it detects that the aircraft is not in autonomous control mode, and ensure that the mode transition is smooth and error-free, avoiding any adverse effects on the aircraft's flight status.
During the mode transition process, the system shall monitor the aircraft status in real time to ensure that all parameters and states during the transition meet safety requirements.
The system shall have anomaly detection and handling mechanisms to ensure that safety measures can be promptly taken in case of anomalies during the go-around process.
The system shall record all critical operations and status changes during mode transitions and go-around procedures for subsequent safety analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: Push the throttle to 100% position, transition the flight phase to climb segment 2, control the aircraft longitudinally to climb to the final approach altitude, and laterally to intercept the final approach course from the current position. After reaching the final approach altitude and leveling off, the aircraft will exit the go-around status and set the flaps to 15°. Then re-enter the final approach course and land again.
safety_requirements: The system should verify that the flight phase correctly transitions to Climb Segment 2 when the throttle is pushed to the 100% position, and ensure that the commands for longitudinal and lateral control are accurate and error-free.

During the climb phase, the system should monitor the aircraft's altitude and position in real time to ensure it climbs along the predetermined route and altitude, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

After the system reaches the predetermined altitude on the final approach, it should automatically exit the go-around mode and verify that the flaps are correctly set to 15°, ensuring the aircraft status meets the expected conditions.
The system shall ensure accurate longitudinal and lateral control commands for the aircraft when re-entering the final approach, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

During the system's go-around process, it should monitor the aircraft's altitude, speed, and position in real time to ensure safe landing along the predetermined route and altitude, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: The aircraft's motion is controlled through the deflection of control surfaces and adjustment of the engine throttle.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure that control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustment commands are not tampered with during transmission to guarantee the accuracy and safety of aircraft motion control.

The system should monitor in real-time the status of control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustment, ensure they are consistent with the expected commands, and immediately trigger the safety mechanism upon detecting any anomalies.

The system should be designed with redundancy to ensure that, in the event of failure of a single control surface or engine throttle, the aircraft's stability and controllability can be maintained through other control surfaces or engines.
The system should record all control surface deflection and engine throttle adjustment commands and statuses for traceability and analysis in the event of a failure.

requirement: The setting of a starting point is not allowed during the go-around process, but changing the landing direction is permitted.
safety_requirements: The system should prohibit setting a new starting point during the go-around process to ensure continuity and safety of the flight path.

The system should allow for a change in landing direction during the go-around process, but must ensure that the flight path after the directional change meets safety standards to prevent collision with obstacles.
The system should update the flight status and navigation parameters in real time when changing the landing direction to ensure the accuracy and safety of the flight path.
The system should continuously monitor the flight status during the go-around process, detect any abnormal conditions, and trigger the warning mechanism when necessary.

requirement: Stall issues during flight are critical to safety and cannot be ignored; their identification and handling require special attention.
safety_requirements: The system should have the capability to monitor flight status parameters (such as speed, angle of attack, etc.) in real time in order to promptly detect stall risks.
The system shall immediately trigger an alarm upon detecting a stall risk and provide clear instruction information to guide the pilot in taking appropriate measures.
The system should have automatic or semi-automatic stall recovery functionality to ensure flight safety in the event the pilot fails to respond in a timely manner.
The system should record data related to stall events, including but not limited to flight parameters, pilot actions, and system responses, for subsequent analysis and improvement.

requirement: The input data table and output data table for the stall control function requirements need to be clearly defined.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the input data tables and output data tables for stall control functions are clearly defined and cannot be modified without authorization during system operation.
The system should periodically verify the integrity of the input and output data tables for the stall control function to ensure that the data has not been tampered with or corrupted.
The system shall record every access to and modification of the input data table and output data table of the stall control function for audit and traceability purposes.

requirement: The handling process for stall control function requirements needs to be clearly defined.
safety_requirements: The system should define a clear stall control function handling process to ensure that corresponding control measures can be executed promptly and accurately in the event of a stall.
The system should have the capability to monitor flight status in real time, ensuring that the stall control function can be immediately activated upon detecting signs of a stall.
The system should be designed with redundancy to ensure that in the event of a failure of the primary stall control function, the backup function can seamlessly take over and guarantee flight safety.
The system should record execution logs of the stall control function, including trigger conditions, execution process, and results, for subsequent analysis and improvement.

requirement: When the aircraft is in altitude hold flight or flying in glide segment 1 under autonomous or manual correction control mode, if the airspeed is judged to be continuously less than a certain value (refer to the appendix for specific value) for three consecutive times, or the pitch angle is judged to be greater than 10 degrees for three consecutive times, the aircraft is considered to have entered a stall condition.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor airspeed and pitch angle in real time to ensure accurate data acquisition and processing of airspeed and pitch angle when the aircraft is flying at a constant altitude or in the first glide phase, under either autonomous or manual correction control modes.

The system should have a logic to continuously judge airspeed and pitch angle three times in succession, ensuring that when the airspeed is less than the set threshold for three consecutive times or the pitch angle exceeds 10 degrees for three consecutive times, it can promptly identify and determine that the aircraft has entered a stall condition.
The system should immediately trigger a stall warning upon detecting that the aircraft has entered a stall condition, and transmit this status information to the control system and operator.
The system should record the determination results of each airspeed and pitch angle as well as the trigger time of stall status for subsequent analysis and fault diagnosis.

requirement: Transition to climb segment 2, elevator airspeed control, advance throttle to 100%. If the aircraft has entered glide slope 1 and stalls, initiate go-around control.
safety_requirements: When the system transitions into climb phase 2, it should monitor the aircraft's current status in real time to ensure accurate elevator airspeed control commands and trigger the warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should perform real-time monitoring when pushing the throttle to 100% to ensure accuracy and timeliness of command execution, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

The system shall immediately switch to go-around control when detecting that the aircraft has entered glide slope 1 and is stalling, ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of the go-around control commands.

The system should perform state consistency checks when switching control modes to ensure data integrity and consistency during the switching process, and trigger an alarm mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: When the airspeed is judged to have increased beyond the given speed for five consecutive times, the aircraft exits the stall condition and transitions to either the climb phase 2 or the altitude-hold phase based on the current altitude deviation, continuing the flight.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor airspeed in real time, ensuring that when the airspeed is judged to have increased beyond a given speed for five consecutive times, it can accurately determine whether the aircraft has exited the stall condition.

After determining that the aircraft has exited the stall condition, the system shall accurately identify and transition to the correct flight phase (climb phase 2 or altitude hold phase) based on the current altitude deviation.

The system should perform real-time consistency checks when determining the flight phase to ensure the accuracy and integrity of altitude deviation data, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
After the system transitions into a new flight phase, it shall ensure the correct updating of all relevant control parameters and state variables to guarantee flight safety.

requirement: The aileron deflection command needs to undergo allocation of control surface commands before the control surface deflection angles command calculated by the control law is output to the actuator.
safety_requirements: When the system allocates aileron deflection commands, it should ensure the accuracy and consistency of the allocation results, preventing abnormal actuator movements caused by allocation errors.

The system should verify the integrity and validity of the aileron deflection command before outputting it to the actuator, ensuring the command conforms to the expected control law calculation results.

The system should have the capability to detect and handle abnormal situations during the aileron deflection command allocation process, such as triggering corresponding safety mechanisms when commands exceed predetermined ranges or conflicts occur.

requirement: The efficiency of aileron upward deflection and aileron downward deflection is different, with lower efficiency during upward deflection and higher efficiency during downward deflection. By distributing the control surface deflection commands through different allocation coefficients, the goal of achieving consistent control effectiveness can be attained.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy of the distribution coefficients when assigning aileron surface deflection commands to achieve consistent control effectiveness.

The system should monitor the aileron surface deflection efficiency in real time, ensuring that the difference between upward and downward deflection efficiencies remains within the expected range, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system shall perform redundant verification when calculating and distributing rudder deflection commands to ensure the correctness and consistency of the commands.
The system should record the allocation process and results of aileron control surface deflection commands for traceability during fault analysis.

requirement: If the aileron deflection command δx > 0, then the left aileron deflection command δxL = k1 δx, and the right aileron deflection command δxR = k2.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that when the aileron deflection command δx > 0, the calculated results of the left aileron deflection command δxL and the right aileron deflection command δxR comply with the formulas δxL = k1 δx and δxR = k2, and the calculation results are accurate and error-free.
The system should monitor the aileron deflection commands δx, δxL, and δxR in real time to ensure they remain within normal ranges and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the calculation process and results of the aileron deflection commands δx, δxL, and δxR for fault analysis and auditing purposes.

requirement: Flight autonomous control means that the aircraft independently completes all tasks from takeoff, cruise, return to base, to landing, including handling emergency situations during flight.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that all flight mode transitions and emergency handling during autonomous flight control comply with predefined safety policies and operational procedures.
The system should have the capability to monitor and record flight status in real time, ensuring that all operations and decisions during the flight process can be traced under any circumstances.
The system should be capable of automatically triggering predefined safety measures, such as automatic return-to-home or emergency landing, when detecting abnormal flight conditions or emergencies.
The system shall ensure that all control commands generated and executed during autonomous flight control are verified through multiple channels to prevent unauthorized interference.
The system should be designed with redundancy to ensure that flight safety and autonomous control functions can still be maintained in the event of a failure in critical components.

requirement: If the aileron deflection command δx < 0, then the left aileron deflection command δxL = k2 δx, and the right aileron deflection command δxR = k1 δx, where k1 is the upward deflection distribution coefficient and k2 is the downward deflection distribution coefficient.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure accurate calculation of the left aileron deflection command δxL and the right aileron deflection command δxR, in accordance with the distribution coefficients k1 and k2, when the aileron deflection command δx < 0.
The system should monitor the aileron deflection command δx value in real time, ensure it remains within the valid range, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

The system shall perform real-time consistency checks on the calculated left aileron deflection angle command δxL and right aileron deflection angle command δxR to ensure their relationship with the aileron deflection angle command δx meets expectations, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: The aileron rudder deflection command allocation function of the flight control and management software shall meet qualification requirements and be verified through testing and review.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure that the aileron control surface command allocation function complies with airworthiness requirements in all flight modes, guaranteeing the accuracy and reliability of the commands.

The system should implement a rigorous testing and review process to ensure that the aileron deflection command allocation function operates correctly under all flight conditions, preventing any potential errors or malfunctions.

The system should record the test and review results of the aileron control surface command allocation function, ensuring that all test data and review records are traceable for subsequent audit and verification.

requirement: The flight control and management software shall be capable of calculating the stall speed based on the given flight weight, altitude, and flight true airspeed.
safety_requirements: The system shall ensure the accuracy and completeness of input flight weight, altitude, and flight vacuum speed data when calculating stall speed, to prevent inaccurate results due to data errors.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure the timeliness and validity of input data when calculating stall speed, and to trigger a warning mechanism in case of data anomalies.
The system should have data validation capabilities to ensure the calculated stall speed remains within a reasonable range and trigger safety measures when exceeding preset thresholds.

requirement: The flight control and management software should support stall speed calculations for different flap angles, particularly for a flap angle of 40°.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and integrity of input data when calculating stall speeds at different flap angles, especially for the stall speed calculation at 40° flap.

The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities to ensure that when the flap angle is 40°, the calculated stall speed matches the actual flight condition, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should record the stall speed calculation process and results when the flap angle is 40°, for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: The ground waiting phase transitions to the takeoff ground segment (takeoff roll segment) after the traffic pattern altitude and airport pressure altitude have been set and a takeoff clearance has been received.
safety_requirements: The system should verify the data of the final approach path and airport pressure altitude during the ground waiting phase to ensure its accuracy, preventing erroneous takeoff commands due to data errors.
After receiving a takeoff command, the system should perform multiple verifications to ensure the legitimacy and authenticity of the command, preventing execution of unauthorized takeoff commands.

Before the system enters the takeoff ground segment (takeoff roll segment), it should check the status of all relevant sensors and systems to ensure their normal operation, preventing takeoff failure or accidents due to system malfunctions.

After the system enters the takeoff ground phase (takeoff roll phase), it should monitor flight parameters in real time to ensure they meet takeoff conditions and immediately trigger an emergency stop mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: During the takeoff roll phase, when the airspeed exceeds 30 m/s and the altitude is greater than 15 m, transition to the takeoff climb phase with a softening time limit of 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: During the takeoff roll phase, when the airspeed exceeds 30 m/s and the altitude is greater than 15 m, the system shall smoothly transition to the takeoff climb phase within 2 seconds to ensure flight stability during the transition process.

The system should monitor airspeed and altitude parameters in real time, ensuring a timely transition to the takeoff phase when the airspeed exceeds 30 m/s and the altitude is greater than 15 m, while recording relevant state change logs.

The system should perform status verification when transitioning into the takeoff and departure phase, ensuring that all relevant parameters and system statuses meet expectations; otherwise, it should trigger a warning mechanism.

requirement: During the takeoff departure phase, when the flight altitude exceeds the safety height of 80m, it transitions into climb segment 1. The elevator channel adopts a method of setting integrator initial value softening, while other channels do not require softening.
safety_requirements: During the takeoff climb phase, when the flight altitude exceeds the safety height of 80m, it shall be ensured that the integrator initialization softening method for the elevator channel is correctly executed to guarantee flight safety.

During the takeoff departure phase, when the flight altitude exceeds the safety altitude of 80m, the system shall monitor the flight altitude in real time and prohibit transition to climb segment 1 until the altitude reaches 80m.

During the takeoff phase, when the flight altitude exceeds the safety height of 80m, the system shall ensure that the control logic of other channels is not affected by the integrator initial value softening method and remains operational.

The system shall record and report all relevant status changes and control operations when the flight altitude exceeds the safety height of 80 m during the takeoff departure segment, for subsequent analysis and audit.

requirement: During climb segment 1, start retracting the landing gear. If the landing gear is retracted, delay for 5 seconds before starting to retract the flaps. If the landing gear has not been retracted after 1 minute, directly retract the flaps to 0 degrees. If the flaps are retracted to 0 degrees, delay for 5 seconds before transitioning to climb segment 2. If more than 75 seconds have elapsed since entering climb segment 1 and the flaps have still not reached 0 degrees, directly transition to climb segment 2. The softening time limit when transitioning to climb segment 2 is 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the landing gear status in real time when retracting the landing gear at the beginning of climb segment 1, ensuring successful retraction within 1 minute; otherwise, the flaps shall be directly set to 0 degrees.

The system should delay for 5 seconds after the landing gear is successfully retracted before starting to retract the flaps, ensuring the delay time is accurate and the flap retraction process is smooth.
The system should delay for 5 seconds after the flaps are retracted to 0 degrees before transitioning to climb segment 2, ensuring accurate delay time and smooth state transition.

After the system enters the climb phase 1, if the flaps have not been retracted to 0 degrees within the 75-second time limit, it should directly transition to climb phase 2, ensuring timely status transition.
When the system transitions to Climb Phase 2, the softening time limit should be set to 2 seconds to ensure smooth and non-abrupt state transition.
The system should monitor the status of landing gear and flaps in real time, ensuring that warning mechanisms can be triggered promptly and corresponding measures taken in any abnormal situation.

requirement: In the climb phase 2, if the aircraft does not stall, corresponding actions are taken based on the difference DH between current altitude and target altitude: 1) When DH > 10m, switch to descent phase, set softening time limit to 2 seconds, and use the method of setting integrator initial value for softening in the elevator channel. 2) When -10m ≤ DH ≤ 10m, switch to altitude hold phase, set softening time limit to 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: During the system's climb phase 2, the difference DH between the aircraft's current altitude and the desired altitude should be monitored in real-time to ensure it remains within the valid range. When DH exceeds 10m, the system should accurately transition to the descent phase. The softening time limit is set to 2 seconds, and the elevator channel uses a method of setting the integrator's initial value for softening.

During the climb phase 2, the system should monitor in real time the difference DH between the aircraft's current altitude and the desired altitude, ensuring it remains within the valid range, and accurately transition to the altitude hold phase when -10m ≤ DH ≤ 10m, with a softening time limit set to 2 seconds.

The system should perform real-time status consistency checks when transitioning into the descent phase or altitude-holding phase, ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of status transitions, and triggering the early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The system should ensure data integrity and accuracy during the calculation of height difference DH and state transitions, preventing data loss or tampering.

requirement: Set the initial values of the altitude hold control integrator, altitude tracking integrator, and throttle control integrator (calculate the initial value of the throttle control integrator assuming the throttle position is 100%) to perform softening, preparing for altitude hold control and altitude tracking control.
safety_requirements: The system should ensure the accuracy and consistency of initial values when setting the altitude control integrator, altitude tracking integrator, and throttle control integrator to prevent control failure or anomalies caused by incorrect initial values.

When setting the integrator initial value, the system should perform real-time verification to ensure that the initial value of the throttle position control integrator is calculated correctly when the throttle position is 100%, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of abnormalities.

After setting the integrator initial values, the system should perform an initialization check to ensure that all integrator initial value settings are correct, and record the initialization results for subsequent auditing and fault diagnosis.

requirement: The FCC collects necessary aircraft motion information, compares it with the required motion, obtains the deviation between the actual and ideal motion of the aircraft, then generates control signals by solving the control laws based on this deviation, and inputs these control signals to the relevant actuators, causing the control surfaces to deflect in a specific pattern, thereby achieving control of the aircraft's attitude and motion.
safety_requirements: The FCC should ensure the integrity and accuracy of data when collecting aircraft movement information, preventing data loss or tampering.
When comparing the actual motion of an aircraft with its ideal motion, the FCC should perform real-time data validation to ensure the accuracy of deviation calculations.
When solving the control laws, the FCC should ensure the reliability and stability of the computational process to prevent abnormal control signals caused by calculation errors.

When generating control signals, the FCC should perform real-time consistency checks to ensure the control signals match the current aircraft status and target status, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
The FCC should ensure the integrity and real-time transmission of control signals when inputting them to the relevant actuator, preventing signal delay or loss.
The FCC should have fault detection and diagnosis capabilities, and be able to take timely measures upon detecting anomalies, ensuring the safety of aircraft attitude and motion control.

requirement: If on the fifth leg of the traffic pattern flight and has entered the glide slope window, transition to Glide Slope Segment 1; otherwise, handle according to the difference DH between current altitude and desired altitude.
safety_requirements: When the system enters the glide window on the fifth leg of the traffic pattern flight, it should immediately transition to Glide Segment 1 and ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the state transition.

The system should monitor the difference DH between the current altitude and the target altitude in real time, and perform corresponding processing based on preset thresholds to ensure stability and safety of the flight status.
The system should perform data integrity and consistency checks during state transitions to ensure the correctness and validity of all relevant parameters.
The system should have an anomaly detection mechanism that promptly triggers a warning and takes appropriate measures when the DH value exceeds the preset range, to prevent flight accidents.

requirement: When DH > 50m, switch to the descent phase, set the softening time limit to 2s, and use the method of setting integrator initial value softening for the elevator channel.
safety_requirements: When DH > 50m, the system shall accurately determine and transition to the descent phase, ensuring the softening time limit is set to 2s, and the elevator channel shall be softened using a method that sets the integrator initial value.

When the system transitions to the descent phase, it should monitor the DH value in real time to ensure that it remains greater than 50m; otherwise, an exception handling mechanism should be triggered.
When setting the integrator initial value softening in the system, the softening process should be smooth to avoid abrupt changes in the flight condition and ensure flight safety.
The system should record DH values and key parameters during the softening process for fault analysis and traceability in case of anomalies.

requirement: When DH < -50m, transition to climb phase 2, set the softening time limit to 2 seconds, and use the method of setting integrator initial value softening for the elevator channel.
safety_requirements: The system shall immediately transition to Climb Phase 2 upon detecting DH < -50m, and ensure the softening time limit is accurately set to 2 seconds.

When the system transitions into Climb Phase 2, a method of setting initial integrator values should be adopted to ensure a smooth transition in the elevator channel and prevent instability caused by abrupt changes.

The system should monitor the DH value in real time, ensuring that the transition to climb phase 2 is triggered promptly when DH < -50m, and maintaining system stability and safety during the transition.
The system should record the time and relevant parameters of each transition into climb phase 2 for subsequent analysis and troubleshooting.

requirement: When the normal lateral control mode flag is changed to final approach from other modes, set the initial value of the altitude tracking integrator for softening; when the normal lateral control mode flag is switched from final approach to other modes, set the initial value of the altitude hold control integrator for softening.
safety_requirements: When the system changes from other modes to five-side flight in the general sign lateral control mode, it should ensure the initial value of the altitude tracking integrator is correctly set and perform softening processing to prevent abrupt changes from affecting flight stability.

When the system changes the lateral control mode from five-side flight to another method, it should ensure that the initial value of the altitude control integrator is correctly set and perform soft processing to prevent abrupt changes from affecting flight stability.
The system should monitor the status changes of the general sign lateral control signs in real time and record relevant logs when status changes occur, to facilitate fault diagnosis and auditing.

The system should perform a consistency check during state transitions to ensure that the initial value settings of the high tracking integrator and altitude control integrator match the current flight mode, and trigger a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: Process according to the value of DH, which is the difference between current altitude and desired altitude: if -10m ≤ DH ≤ 10m, switch to the constant altitude phase, set the softening time limit to 2 seconds, and initialize the values of the constant altitude control integrator, altitude tracking integrator, and throttle control integrator for softening, preparing for constant altitude control and altitude tracking control.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor the difference DH between the current altitude and the desired altitude in real time, ensuring that it is within the range of -10m to 10m before correctly transitioning to the constant altitude phase and setting the softening time limit to 2 seconds.

When the system enters the constant altitude phase, it should initialize the initial values of the constant altitude control integrator, altitude tracking integrator, and throttle control integrator to ensure a smooth and safe transition process.

The system should perform a consistency check on all relevant parameters when transitioning into the altitude hold phase, ensuring the accuracy of initial values and triggering a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

requirement: When DH < -10m, it transitions to the descent phase.
safety_requirements: The system should monitor DH parameters in real time to ensure their accuracy and immediately trigger a command to enter the descent phase when DH < -10m.
The system should perform a dual confirmation before transitioning to the descent phase to ensure accurate reading and judgment of DH parameters, avoiding misoperations.
The system should record the time and relevant parameters each time a DH < -10m triggers a transition to the descent phase, for subsequent audit and fault analysis.
The system should have an exception handling mechanism to promptly alarm and take safety measures when DH parameters are abnormal or sensors fail, preventing the system from entering an unsafe state.

requirement: Enter climb phase 2, set softening time limit to 2 seconds, and use the method of setting integrator initial value softening for the elevator channel.
safety_requirements: When the system enters the second climbing phase, it should ensure that the softening time limit is set to 2 seconds, and monitor the status of the elevator channel in real-time during the softening process to ensure a smooth transition.

When setting the integrator initial value softening in the system, real-time verification should be performed to ensure the accurate setting of the integrator initial value and trigger the early warning mechanism in case of anomalies.
When the system enters the second climbing phase, it should record key parameters and status during the softening process for fault diagnosis and post-event analysis.

requirement: In the glide phase 1, when the flight altitude is below 100m, switch to glide phase 2, reset the straight lateral slip control integrator and heading control hold integrator, prepare for flight control in glide phase 2, and set the soft time limit to 2 seconds.
safety_requirements: The system should accurately detect and transition to the second glide segment when the flight altitude is below 100m, ensuring a smooth transition of the flight condition.

When the system transitions to glide slope segment 2, it should immediately reset the straight-side-slip control integrator and heading control hold integrator to ensure the accuracy of the new flight control parameters.

When the system transitions to the second glide phase, a softening time limit of 2 seconds should be set to ensure a smooth transition of flight control, and real-time monitoring should be conducted within the softening time limit to prevent abnormal situations from occurring.
The system should trigger a safety warning mechanism to notify the operator and record relevant events when the flight altitude is below 100m, for subsequent analysis.

requirement: In the glide slope segment 2, when the flight altitude is below 17m, it transitions to the flare segment. The elevator channel adopts a method of setting initial integral value softening, while other channels do not require softening.
safety_requirements: The system should accurately detect and transition to the flare segment when the flight altitude is below 17m, ensuring the correct execution of the integrator initial value softening operation in the elevator channel.

When the system enters the flare segment, it should monitor the flight altitude in real time to ensure that the integrator initial value softening operation of the elevator channel is triggered promptly when the altitude is below 17m.
When the system transitions into the flare phase, it should ensure that the control logic of other channels remains unaffected and maintains normal operation.
The system should perform real-time consistency checks when executing the integrator initial value softening operation to ensure accuracy and reliability of the operation.
When the system enters the flattening phase, relevant operation logs should be recorded for subsequent audit and fault analysis.

requirement: When the aircraft is in the ground waiting phase, the elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command are all set to 0°.
safety_requirements: When the aircraft is in the ground waiting phase, the system shall ensure that the elevator deflection command, aileron deflection command, and rudder deflection command are all set to 0°, and perform real-time monitoring to prevent unauthorized modifications.

The system should perform status verification when transitioning the aircraft from the ground waiting phase to other flight phases, ensuring the correctness and consistency of control surface deflection commands, and triggering a warning mechanism in case of anomalies.

When the system transitions from the roll-out phase to the landing rollout phase, it should monitor the gear fully compressed signal in real-time, ensuring that it remains true for 12 consecutive frames before correctly transitioning to the landing rollout phase and recording this event.
